description:
Amazing delivery experience. Ordered food on a Saturday night and it arrived in about 45 min. The pizza was hot and fresh. It came with Parmesan cheese and hot peppers. 

I was in the mood for deep dish and Piccolo was one of the few places that delivered deep dish to me. The deep dish options on the menu are just with cheese. If you want other toppings you need to add them. To my surprise that I received was not deep dish, but actually cheese stuffed crust with regular pizza. And oh boy was it delicious! I would highly recommend it to anyone!
author: Alan H.

description:
A Piccolo Pizza review, in haiku form:
Quick! Pop quiz hot shot:
It's midnight and you need food.
Where do you go? Here.
author: Carl M.

description:
This place is literally right around the corner from my mom's and since it is so easily accessible it just makes it all the more convenient that it is probably my husband's favorite place to grab a slice or an entire pie if it's been awhile. 

Like any self respecting fast paced City with a lively night life you have to have a few pizza joints that stay open well past the bedtime of the norm and that coincides with the last call for alcohol to most places and this place closes at 3AM. 

My husband's favorite is wittingly named the "Larkin". It is combination of meats, lightly sauced, generously cheesed on a yummy non over-powering crust. The sauce is just the right tangy to compliment the ooey gooey of that cheese and the greasy of the meats. Perfect pie to soak up all the alcohol consumed beforehand or just as a late night treat.

I can't guarantee,  but I believe this large pie is $20/$25 but the slices are so big and the cheese and meat plentiful that it takes only 1 to 2 slices to satisfy your craving and roaring beast of hunger. 

Just do it....you won't be disappointed!
author: AmErica A.

description: This is actually my new go-to spot for some late night pizza. A huge plus is that they are open until 3 am and deliver! Their pizza deals are also ridiculous. You can get two large two topping pizzas + 2 liter soda for $29. There isn't anything crazy about this pizza but definitely a solid pie that satisfies any pizza craving you are having. I love a good mushroom + sausage pizza and the delivery usually arrives within 30/45 minutes. I would really recommend this place any time of the day, especially if it's late at night and you really want some pizza
author: Eric L.

description: Tasty, fast service pizza. We ordered a small Piccolo (meat and veggies) and half order of the garlic bread. The garlic bread was decent, garlicky with cheese melted on top. Yum . It came with a side of ranch which I thought was unusual- hoped it would be marinara or something. Pizza was quite good, definitely exceeded my expectations! Crust was light, dough was good. I thought the toppings were great too, reminded me of a combination pizza. Service was fast. If you eat in there are some tables and a small counter to sit at. They also sell individual slices, pasta, appetizers (onion rings, mozzarella sticks, jalapeño poppers, wings....). Overall solid no frills pizza and pasta!! Yum!!
author: Amanda C.

description: Very good hot pizza. Limited seating. After you leave, they clean the table right after you leave so other people could sit and enjoy their pizza on a clean table. They were opened late, and it's always busy. Glad we came here for a late night snack :) next time I want to try their pasta. We saw some people eating their pastas and it looked and smelled so good!
author: Jenn H.

description:
A decent place to pickup a slice in The Tenderloin (pizza I mean). Closer to deep dish than thin crust.  This crust was homemade and hand-rolled/tossed on the premises, which should be the starting point for any pizza place with an iota of pride (Yes...I'm looking at you Round Table)

That said, my slices were just above average. From the choices displayed I ordered one chicken/spinach/pesto ($4) and one pepperoni ($3.25). Each slice was hefty. The crust was good but not great; a little too doughy for me...and not very sturdy.  The toppings were generous but the cheese didn't wow me. But my two slices filled the void in my tummy for just over seven bucks. 3.5 stars.

Paying here was a clusterF. The people in front of us took a long time just to pay (several minutes). It turned out the credit card machine was having issues. They finally worked out a solution of some kind...not clear.  When it was our turn, my friend S. tried to pay with her card; but she got inscrutable results after two attempts.  So the counter guy asked for cash, which I happened to have. (But then S. felt the need to check her card statement to make sure she wasn't actually charged)  Why didn't they just post a sign saying "Cash Only"?

But I'd go here again if hungry, and I had cash on me. Though I'd probably look around a little more first.
author: Dan B.

description:
This place has definitely become one of my top pizza places for delivery! Cheap, delicious, fast delivery, a large pizza, and a unique taste all to itself, Piccolo is definitely on our rotation now.

The crust is different from others that we usually get in that it's somewhat sweeter, but still tasty. We ordered the Margherita pizza for the two of us for delivery. The order came in under the time estimate which was great and at a perfect temperature. 

Their large was a good size for two people for a dinner with leftovers for the next day, provided you eat relatively normal sized portions. The denseness and volume of the cheese reminded me a lot like street food pizza you might get late at night, but way better quality. Overall the pizza just was some of the best I've had in this particular style.

Don't let the looks fool you, this is some grade A pizza!
author: Cassandra J.

description: I've been going to this place for a long time now even though I don't live across the street anymore. They're food is delicious and fresh. However, it is a small little place so there isn't anywhere to sit or hang around unless you got lucky and went there when there's no one on the little tables they have. Also they got free delivery!
author: Thricia Z.

description: Wooow the most delicious pizza i love it i don't care to drive 1 hour this pizza is amazing. The only bad thing is the homeless ‍
author: Scarleth G V.

description:
I would really love to say they have amazing food and service, but I wouldn't know because after waiting for hours my food never arrived. Now I get to go through the pain of trying to get my money back. Epic fail.

Take away: You can wait for hours and hours and your food will not arrive.
author: Jillian M.

description: The food is good the PROBLEM is Delivery I order from here all the time only because they are the only place open so late. My delivery is ALWAYS late and COLD ! For me to be a regular customer this is not acceptable! I paid for a hot meal not a cold one. This has happened multiple times and management seems to not even care. When I make a special request in the Description it ALWAYS gets completely ignored. A REGULAR CUSTOMER should be getting treated more properly.
author: Janeice H.

description: Loved it! One of the better NY style slices I've had. Crispy bottom, fluffy crust, melty cheese that doesn't just all come off in a sheet together but instead actually pulls away all stretchy and stuff. It was so sweet to see kids who are clearly regulars come in and the guys made them a special slice with "a million bajillion pepperonis" on it. I wish the slices were bigger in true NY fashion but boy did it hit the spot. Will definitely be going back!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Was staying at hotel Spero in union square this week and didn't feel like going out for dinner so the family and I decided to order delivery and gave this place a shot.....to our surprise we might have ordered some of the best pizza we've had in a while. The crust was perfect, crunchy on the outside but soft and moist on the inside. Pizza sauce was tasty and toppings were of great quality. We will definitely be back next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Jaz M.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants 
Very cheap and the serving portion size of the food is very big
They have the best philly cheese steak. I usually order it through my phone and come pick it up. It doesn't take more than 10 minutes to be ready . A big sandwich with alooot of French fries for only $10 .
The staff and employees are very nice and helpful 
They have halal meat which is the best thing.
author: Mohammad S.

description:
My favorite place to eat pizza in city.
Very delicious pizza and sandwiches. The slices are big and good price.
author: Cad D.

description:
Ordered through GH - cheese stick & cheese pizza. Not impressed with pizza crust (neither thick nor thin) , bland mix of cheese. Mozzarella sticks were alright. 

Definitely first & last time
author: Hester D.

description: Halal food. Clean place. Delicious food. Fast food. Cheap price. A good manager. Easy to find the place
author: Murodjon I.

description: Terrible customer service - ordered pizza at 1pm and called because it was 3 pm and no pizza. They said they were working on it..I never got the pizza.
author: stephany m.

description: Visiting San Francisco with friends. After a visit and walk from the Lumbard Street we decided the find a place to eat. And found a great pizza place. If you are looking for fresh and authentic Italian food this is the place. We had the antipasto. The tomatos, cheese, basil, and olive oil is wonderful. This was perfect on this hot day. We also, had three pizzas. The margarita basil.... yummy. Great crust. Will definetly return.
author: Elizabeth F.

description: Open late, delicious af, tucked in the ghetto, I mean shoot what more could you ask for. I'm sitting in my car right now at 2:30 eating pizza and drinking pellegrino. And the staff is ridiculously friendly. I love yoooooou guys
author: Angelina P.

description: Sexual harassment. I placed my order over the phone and as I was getting off the phone the employee says, I love you." I just hung up. One hour later my order still has not arrived. When I called back to ask about my order the employee pretended the phone wasn't working. So you refuse to deliver my food because I didn't return the "I love you?" Sick.
author: BooBoo K.

description: A must stop when you're out here in San Francisco, one of our favorite pizza spots to grab a large pizza and wings. It's a little hole in the wall with small seating area; the guy in the front is awesome, as busy as they are they make sure to take good care of you.
author: Maritza L.

description: The best option at the end of the night. Also the pizza is fugggggggggin goooooooooood
author: Ben S.

description: Ordered a deep dish pizza with three toppings mozzarella sticks and using the slice app was told I get a free salad for the purchase of anything over $25. The delivery guy comes in there's no salad I don't get a deep dish pizza there are no napkins there are no forks there are no plates there nothing. I paid $40 for essentially nothing.
author: Kevin S.

description: Best halal Italian we've had in SF! The pasta and sandwiches are delicious and fresh. Food comes straight from the oven to you and tastes great! Owner was very nice and helpful. Definitely coming back!
author: Savera B.

description: DAMN I CRAVE FOR THEIR PIZZA! Thanks god I live soooooo closed to you. I cannot choose my favorite pizza from your menu because all of them are like my children. I have just eaten white and the day before I ate  pepperoni. You are sooooo good!!!
author: Zeynep D.

description:
First time eating at this resturant was really good, food was tasty and affordable, pizza was so good and the wings were just boom hella good, the staffs were hella nice and friendly! Best customer service..

I would definitely come back and highly recommend
author: Nafiza M.

description: Best Pizza place around this area and this place is really friendly .. half pepperoni half combination is my favorite....
author: Ray R.

description:
Great Pizza joint. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. I came in 10:30am and they open at 11:00, but the staff let me come in and took my order. Very nice of them. 

One of the only halal pizza places in SF bay area. The pizza tastes great and the prices are low. Overall great experience. Bookmarked Piccolo Pizza will definitely be back for more. Highly recommend this place to all.
author: Diyor K.

description:
I ordered pizza on Seamless.
The driver didn't deliver our order to our door. He called me outside the building and demand me to come downstairs because he couldn't find a parking spot. If the driver cannot leave his delivery vehicle, the restaurant shouldn't advertise they deliver, or at lease they should add the exception for large residential complex. 
Never order from them again.
author: Narihiro K.

description: I live right around the corner and eat here fairly regularly. The family and staff that run it are really great! The food is almost always delish. I have had a few random occasions when I was less than impressed but overall they come through and are open late! Highly recommend the cheese pizza or the Philly Cheese steak! They do serve by the slice which I love. This place is a great stop if you have a pizza craving or need a late night after hours fix!!!
author: Michael W.

description:
Awesome hole in the wall pizza place. Friendly staff with quick and delicious pizza. 

If you don't like doughy pizza, you might not like it.
author: Taylor L.

description: I always order delivery from these guys when I want decent pizza in a short amount of time. Their delivery speed is lightning fast. They always beat the yelp estimate by 50%. I recommend getting their Hawaiian turkey ham pizza. They have a great cheese-tomato sauce- topping ratio and my favorite part of their pizza is the fluffy crust. It almost dissolved in your mouth. I wasn't impressed with their chicken spinach pesto pizza. I thought that it was undercooked. The bbq chicken was a close second to the Hawaiian.
author: Sebastian B.

description: Their food is somewhat okay .next time when I order. I just get pizza  with French fries
author: Akisha P.

description: The pizza was delicious! The pasta was good, but after heating it up we noticed that way too much oil was used in it!
author: Hemali M.

description: Deep dish cheese pizza w/ ricotta cheese is so good. Ordered the ravioli with alfredo and it was a little too rich for my liking but it wasn't terrible . They're open late and deliver late, so it's definitely my go-to when late night grub is needed, for sure. (Delivery time was pretty quick on a Friday night too)
author: Ełizabeth H.

description:
Just started going to this place recently.  The guys who run it are super nice and friendly and it's almost always busy, especially since the neighborhood has come up with lots of new bars (and hipsters wanting pizza to soak up all the alcohol).

The pizza is decent - not the best or worst I've ever had - but the Philly cheesesteak sandwich is GINORMOUS!!  It's not quite like the cheesesteaks you will get in Philly, rather a little more bready, but the meat is good and it's cheesy and gooey.  Finishing an entire one from Piccolo will put you in a serious food coma.  The sandwiches come with lots of fries which were also good.  I'll definitely be back to try the other sandwiches.
author: Jon B.

description: The worst delivery service!!!!! I ordered my pizza 1 hr 45 minutes ago and I'm still waiting for it......
author: FeRnanda A.

description: Ordered delivery. Took an hour, 15 minutes past quoted delivery time. 21 bucks for a 12" veggie with anchovies. Highly recommend not ordering anchovies. Not your typical salted anchovy but a what once was fresh anchovy. Added an overall fishy taste to the pie. Also dough is not made in-house, they use the preorder dough which makes the price that much more insulting. Ingredients probably cost them under 5 bucks and mine at least was way undercooked. This is a below average pizza shop. Again my experience was thru delivery at midnight on a Thursday.
author: Madison M.

description: Pizza arrived 30 minutes after placing order! Was hot and correctly as ordered. Stuffed crust was very yummy when hot. Overall pizza was average but extra star for speedy delivery and hot pizza
author: Nancy H.

description:
Abir's long gone and Piccolo has stayed my go-to pizza place. We've had a couple missteps, but they always make up for it with yummy pizza and salads, fast, free delivery and pleasant counter service - even for big orders. 

Love these guys :)
author: Kim C.

description: This place is my favorite halal pizza place. When I order I get 2 large pizzas. Beef Pepperoni, beef sausage and chicken pesto. I usually order for delivery and the delivery guy comes on time for the most part and the pizza is still hot. I love coming here because the pizza is consistent every time. I eat here maybe once a week. The price is fair and the food is good. What else do you want!!!
author: Moe C.

description: I oirder a deep dish and give me wrong pizzza and then come with my pizza and my friend eat a one slice to the ther and for that don't give me my pizza... not was my mistake i think my other pizza could be free
author: Riicky S.

description: Crust tastes good, the cheese could be better quality, but the reason why im rating this so low is because there is no sauce on the pizza. The pizza is good but i hate how theres hardly any sauce at all on it
author: Edvina S.

description: Prime real estate right here folks! I'm talking amazon prime!!! Max tasty and delicious! Super yum yum, in the tum tum! Staff is super kind and welcoming! Solid prices, and even more solid food. Can't go wrong with this place. They have the CHAR, I'm telling you people. Gandalf would be quite pleased! Yeah, it's that good.
author: Josh R.

description: While we were in San Francisco on vacation we decide to try this place the Philly steak was excellent so was the chicken Philly steak we order cheesecake which was delicious I highly recommend this place if you're in the San Francisco area staying at one of the local hotel or deliver just request a very early
author: R B.

description: Its a 3 star pizza slice place like all the others around here. I prefer Maysoons and the other near larkin on Geary. But it's cheap
author: Sean H.

description: this is the worst place ever! the driver was rude. demanded a tip & got mad & cuss me out because i don't give him one for they overpriced pizza. i will never!!! order from this piece of shit again & the driver should be fired immediately.
author: Marvin H.

description:
So I've been going to picoli Italiano sense I've lived in San Francisco...
And I have come back for more and more and more for one reason and that is it is the closest thing I can find to an East Coast New York/Pennsylvania style pizza!

Hell my boss earned my respect when she ordered picoli for a staff event!
And every single friend I introduce it to has said "oh my god. This-is-amazing-wheredidyoufindityuuuummmm" 

Also a pro tip for all you pizza lovers new to the Bay Area.... You cannot go wrong with the stuffed crust. Unless you're lactose intolerant 

Their Stromboli/calzone are pretty fucking amazing too!

DieHard Picoli Customer-
author: Jason R.

description: Very good pizza by the slice! Especially the Haiwaiian pizza. Highly recommend. Watch your back after dark on the street.
author: Bill C.

description: Went here on my lunch break. Had a slice of pizza. Great customer service. Workers were friendy  treated  me like their friend. Pizza was amazing
author: Will G.

description: When ever I'm in San Francisco Piccolos is the only pizza spot I eat at. Pesto Pepperoni is the way to go. Great food, low prices and fast delivery. Doesn't get any better than that.
author: Zahead M.

description: These guys are always super fast, polite, helpful. This place has a perfect concept of value for money. Thank you...
author: Fikret D.

description: I ordered delivery from this restaurant and I have currently been waiting over 1 hour to get my meal. I called the restaurant twice for a status update and I have been told that "they are busy" with no estimated timeline on when I will receive the meal that I paid for. I would not order from here again!
author: Christina B.

description: This is a great pizza spot in the Tenderloin, been coming here for years! Always great pizza and service!
author: Christopher R.

description: I used to order from this place. Although it's a couple of blocks from my home, it takes a long time to deliver. I didn't mind that much. But last time, my order was wrong. Still no big deal. I went to tell the delivery guy but he left quickly. So I called him and he said he's going to bring the right order back. So that's 20 minutes more of waiting. Once he got back and delivered the right order, I expected to get some apology or maybe credit or refund. But no! The delivery guy asked for the wrong order back! I told him I threw it away. He said to get it. I asked from the trash? He said yes. WHO DOES THAT? How cheap can you be? What is wrong with you? So I went and got it from the trash and gave it back to him. What they are going to do with it is beyond me but I don't trust to get food from them again. Maybe my next order is someone else's trash!
author: Milad A.

description: Yung pizza here , ya boy b from the NY johnys and ya aready know we hold them pizza johnys down thats all day. Ya dont hold pizza johnys down. Still 4/5 tho.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Pretty easy to order/pick up. 

The well by the slice, we got a medium pineapple be jalapeño pizza and a side of jalapeño poppers.

The crust was delicious. A definite must for anyone at the Tenderloin area of San Francisco.
author: Gustavo G.

description:
Piccolo Pizza is the very good. I have been eating here for awhile. All the guys that work there are very friendly and helpful. They also stay open late so that is a big plus. 

Must try this place out.
author: Latoya B.

description:
These guys put up with a lot of crazy people in the late night. Sometimes, I'm one of them. 
And therefore, they have earned my utmost respect. They stay open late, always have fresh pizza slices available for the masses who just need a slice or two.
Yet, today, I write this review after receiving a delivery for the first time. Prompt, friendly service, my pizza arrived not only within a very acceptable timeframe, but it was hot and fresh as could be.
What more could you want from a pizzeria? 

Used to order from Dominoes on Geary. God that place sucked. This place is a golden staple of the TL.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
Ordered a pizza and some jalepeno poppers.  Estimate time was 45-75 minutes, came in 60.
Pizza's pretty good, didn't like the crust, but who really does.  
My order of 6 poppers came with 8 pieces, thats a plus.  And they gave me a 2 liter bottle of soda FREE.

Couldn't give a 5 star,  I thought they gave me a free bottle of water in the bag too, but it was opened and half empty.
author: Eric N.

description: Walked in for a quick dinner option, pizza was delicious (got the one with chicken, spinach, and pesto). Definitely will go back
author: Bill E.

description: Thank you Piccolo Sunday Night Crew! Delicious, fresh and delivered hot!, 25min delivery, kind delivery man and late at night when we got to our hotel after a long day. We had cheese ravioli, salad with the dinner and a cheeseburger and French fries plus drinks all under $30! Ravioli and burger really tasty and all portions were generous. Salad was fresh and loaded with yummy black olives and tomatoes. It was also a generous size. We would order here again.
author: L. V.

description:
My go to pizza!
Closer to my home, they deliver, cheap price, love their Chicken Pesto pizza!
open late too!
what more can you ask for?

oh u want parking? hey you are in San Francisco! ;) peace
author: Rokayah H.

description: I am not around this part of town that much, but if I come back to Great American Music Hall, I will stop by again. I wanted a slice of pizza and walked a block from GAMC and found this spot. I got a Hawaiian slice. I like the rest of their menu, which consists of salads, sandwiches, Italian fast food. The pizza was okay. This reminds me of Irving Pizza. If you are around here and are craving a slice of pizza, this will do the trick. The credit card minimum is $5. The staff member let me get away with a $4.09 credit card charge.
author: Denise C.

description:
I love this pizza place, it's the best one in the TL as far as I'm concerned. I have been going there on the regular for the past 9 years due to their quality of food, quickness and wonderful staff. 

There are plenty of options near by this is the pizza place to go.
author: Conor M.

description:
This is my favorite pizza place in San Francisco.
Their pizza sauce is awesome, not too thick and crispy. Recommend anyone to have the garlic bread. It is just 3.75$ but the taste is more than that.
author: Thanaphon C.

description: The amazing food and quality service has kept me coming here for 2 1/2 years. Truly the best spot in town!
author: Francis K.

description: Good pizza by the slice. I had a slice of Hawaiian and my girlfriend had a plain slice. Hers was just okay. The Hawaiian was delicious. The pineapple tasted very ripe. Thankfully, they had ranch - a must for all of my pizza. Great place for a cheap meal. A couple slices, drinks, and ranch was only about $10.
author: Adam S.

description: Best stoner pizza spot in the city. Super quick and a huge selection, especially for a smaller place. Definitely recommend it after a night out considering they're open too 3 am.
author: Bev S.

description:
The pizza is good, but the service really sucks, especially when the place gets super busy. And bad service just ruins any food. One large slice of pizza can be anywhere between $3 and $6.

The staff suffers from horrible miscommunication. Like they are just a HOT MESS when things get busy. For example, my friend and I tried ordering pepperoni pizza, and one guy said it's coming out of the oven. The cashier who rang us up said there is only cheese pizza left. Are you blind or stupid? The pepperoni pizza is literally sitting on the counter right next to you and you're telling me there is none left. Everyone is so rude too. 

The place is messy and dirty, and I just feel like these are really nice people deep down inside, but they seriously need to get their ____ together.
author: Stefanie C.

description: These guys actually deserve a 4 more so for the service and the fact that they are open late. The Philly cheesesteak is actually decent and their pizza is not bad at all. Definitely my hangover or late night after hours food place cheers!
author: Miguel Y.

description: This is the best Pizza spot in the tenderloin. They always have the freshest ingredients and everyone that works there is very cool. There cheese Pizza is my favorite hands down. They also just started making a chicken bbq Pizza that is awesome and quickly becoming my favorite. They also have really good salads and hot sandwiches. Like there chicken Caesar and Philly cheese steak. Either way you can't go wrong with piccolo's.
author: Dan S.

description:
This pizza is amazing. It is without doubt my favorite pizza place in San Francisco. They sell NY style thin crust pizza and it is the best tasting NY style pizza in San Francisco. In the East Bay my favorite place is Bluebird Pizza. 

Yesterday, i put their pizza to the test ordering a cheese pizza and a chicken pesto pizza from several places and tasting them together. When compared - Piccolo's really stands out.  The cheese pizza stood out because the sauce was full of flavor and balanced the other flavors well. The sauce complimented the cheese and soaked flavor into the crust. I would not have realized how important the sauce was if I had not done the taste test. As for the chicken pesto, Piccolo's was also the clear winner. There were tons of whole leaf basel and the flavor was great. The other chicken pesto pizzas were somewhat bland tasting and had no fresh flavor in comparison (although they tasted good before I bit into the Piccolo Pizza). 

I cannot believe this place only has 3 stars. It makes me wonder if they are just rated average because they are not popular or because they are a hole-in-the-wall.  However, if you just want good taste - then go here.
author: MrandMs Squirrel S.

description: So-So pizza, horrible service! Pizza was 25 mins late. I called, and the person who answered was quite rude. Put me on hold, and eventually said they never got an order! I was looking up my credit card company's customer service number, and the driver texted me "Outside." Wasn't even going to bring it to the door! Even if the service was good, the pizza was subpar. Average crust, in a city that's full of great bread and crusts. Sauce tasted like it was from a can. Too much "Italian" spices sprinkled on cheese. Tried it on a friend's advice. Won't go back. Like Mythic much better.
author: Cub C.

description: Great place with delicious pizza! Me and my boyfriend frequent here at least once a week for a slice. The pizza slices are pretty big, with a good amount of cheese and thick crust. The guys who work there are nice and do their job well.
author: Kelly S.

description: I ordered through eat24 and have it delivered. I did not eat any of the pizza, but I heard the it was pretty good and they delivered on time. The prices are excellent.
author: Peter N.

description: I'm giving 1 star because of the service. I know the owner he's nice the Mexican workers are AWSOME but the people at  the cashier so bad specially to their own people
author: Mohammad A.

description:
As a huge proponent of the "Pizza Nightcap," I couldn't recommend a better pizza joint than Piccolos. I have read many reviews based on service. No offense, but who cares? When the night is winding down and you need delicious pizza to give you that second cheesy wind, Piccolo is there for you! The three times I have visited, I personally have only had the best service experience, and look forward to going again the next time I'm in the city.

The crust is crispy, chewy, and soft...the trifecta! The cheese thick and stringy. They are generous with their toppings and the price can't be beat, especially for the quality. The neighborhood isn't great, but you already know that if you are looking for a place to eat in the Tenderloin lol. I really can't visit San Fran without stopping into Piccolo for a late night pie.
author: Rachel A.

description: Ordered a medium pizza, 1/2 plain cheese and 1/2 pepperoni mushroom. Pizza arrived all pepp/mushroom. Delivery was decent, but not what w ordered!
author: Paul W.

description:
Amazing joke tonight ! 

Ordered lasagna with tiramisu and sprite. My order via yelp app was taking by eat24. They took more than 20min to validate it. Then I get delivered 40min after. 
The deliver guy (really nice btw) came with my order in one hand and a coke in the other, so I knew something was wrong. He offer to go back to the restaurant to change it for the sprite I really ordered. 
I just give up and take the coke. 

Finally I open my order and SURPRISE!! find no lasagna but spaghettis with meatballs. So I called back the deliver guy to tell him. After say he was sorry but it was not in charge of the order but only of the delivery he goes back to the restaurant to take my real order. 30 min after because I was starving I contact him again, he say me he was on his way. At this point I was really starving so I decided to eat the tiramisu, it was FROZEN in the middle. 
Finally I Wait 35min more before he really came. 

So in total more than two hours for a simple lasagna delivery. And frozen tiramisu. 

And to complete the joke : I had to give back all the wrong cold food. In case I wanted to eat cold pasta and meat. 

And in case you still want to order after that the food is not exceptional. Not bad but not wonderful.
author: Angélique Y.

description: After a big day exploring the city wanted something quick and hot!! Didn't have much expectation as pizza is always hit and miss.. meal was hot and good value for money came before the expected Time which is always a bonus when your hungry.. tasted amazing and the delivery guy was polite and nice!! Would order again if in the area! Thanks guys!!
author: Katie T.

description: Delicious! One of the best late night pizza in town so far. They do late night delivery which is awesome! coz I'm craving for pizza at 1 am.  I ordered "Tutti Viande Pizza added Pineapple" at 1.10 am. Arrived in 40 mins.     Good size 14" Lotsa meats and cheese, Not too oily, Hot and tasty! I'll definitely order from here again.
author: Kei S.

description: Love this place and the people that work there! My roommate and I are almost there every day and they treat us like family.
author: Myles D.

description: I'm enjoying my pizza and coke, and the gentleman behind the counter allowed me to use the restroom. I like giving my money to businesses that care.
author: Christopher M.

description:
the lasagna was so good 

portion size was completely perfect

highly recommend this place!!!
author: Letty H.

description:
Albeit not gourmet this is a solid place for when you are craving some semi-greasy and delicious delivery pizza.

Delivery has never taken more than 40 minutes and the pizza is always hot.  Prices are extremely reasonable, on grubhub they have a coupon for 2 small pizzas with 2 toppings each for about $18  after tax, easily 3 large meals worth of food.

Pros:  reasonable prices, quick delivery, good pizza for when you are buzzed, turkey ham!

Cons: they tend to be a bit skimpy with pizza sauce, I wouldn't recommend any food besides pizza (have had the wings, hamburgers and salads here, not bad but not good).
author: Mailah G.

description:
My review is based on experience of service. The food might be good but they didn't give themselves the opportunity. 

Looking to save some $ and try a new place. We tried to place 2 orders. 1 cash and 1 CC for 2 different people at same address and they said they could only do cash or CC. Unfortunately wife did CC and I didn't like the fact of either/or type of payment, I canceled the order and called the usual place that I have been ordering from for 4 years loyaly. Now I have to check my statement to make sure of the "rufund/cancelation"......

Piccolo you Lost a potential loyal customer just because you could not accommodate. I am a business owner and when my clients ask if they can split the bill, I always say "Yes" to accommodate customers.
author: A D.

description: Went today and ordered a medium pizza with pepperoni and sausage; some mozzarella sticks & garlic cheese bread. Everything tastes really good ! Thank you, also the staff was very friendly & the cashier was cute haha :)
author: Ivette G.

description: Found this place on Yelp, not from around here. Ordered late night after a concert, man over the phone was so nice and wished us a goodnight. Food was delivered within 35 min and the delivery driver was very nice. Pizza was good, and they have us ranch and jalapeños! Good for late night pizza, ranch kind of thick.....but other then that great for o
author: Liza R.

description:
Delivery gets 0 stars. I ordered from here a few months ago and was quoted 45 minutes. Much, much later, we receive a pizza that is so cold, the cheese is hard. I was so mad! Never again. I just ran into their takeout menu in a drawer and it reminded me to write this review and throw their menu away.

One star for their take-out individual slices late at night, after partying in the area and needing something to eat.
author: Liz M.

description: My favorite place to eat in San Francisco when I'm in a hurry. Love, love love the garlic cheese bread.
author: Robin W.

description: These guys are awesome!!! Even after some eat24/7 app drama we still got our pizza 20 minutes after they closed! Thank you so much!!!!!!!
author: Angelica R.

description: This is my favorite pizzeria in SF! Quality food, low prices, fast service friendly staff, what more could you ask for? I've been coming here for years and it never disappoints. It even impresses my friends from New York which is not easy to do.
author: Happy F.

description:
Been there like 16281 times.. Only once I was sober tho.

Perfect place for your 2-am-bar-closed cravings. Mine is the cheese pizza. They kinda changed the prices in the last 6 months (1$ difference) still cheap tho but that's why I only gave 4 out of 5. 

Free chili powder and Parmesan makes your average cheese pizza perfect. 

Don't go to the bathroom tho.. It's disgusting. 

Perfect place for night owls. Open until half past 3 or something. Nice pizza (except for the veggie one.. Didn't like that)
author: Magdalena Victoria B.

description: Their pizza is so good, the service is fast, and they are open super late, perfect for late night munchies. Their slices are HUGE too, 1 is plenty to fill me up. They have other menu options as well, their French fries and breadsticks are amazing as well. I haven't tried anything else since pizza is my go to, but I definitely recommend for fast, cheap pizza.
author: Rebecca K.

description: I would like to give this place no stars! I can't talk about the food!  Why? Because it didn't get delivered!  I paid 25.00 I included a 4.00 tip because I know these guys don't get paid much. I ordered on eat24 (never again) the place is not to far from where I work. (I can't leave from work)...I keep calling, they keep saying it's coming,  first 20 min passed delivery time, then 35, 45, hour and a half...still no food. I call to cancel, the guy says I will give you a discount,  on what I STILL DON'T HAVE FOOD! Eat24 says "we completely understand. ..hell no you don't!!! I'm freaking hungry,  I'm on my 10 hour of work....and I'm still waiting for food! I don't care how hard and busy you are, at least be understanding,  and not say...Oh we are busy..if that's true, stop taking on line order's, until you are caught up! So I guess it's the vending machine!
author: Ed H.

description: Best pizza in San Francisco. Cooked to perfection thanks to the very honest, hardworking staff. Definitely would recommend.
author: Seth H.

description: Usually best thin crust deep dish! Today  not the case called to tell them of the doughy challenge my stomach awaited, having been famished I blacked out from hunger, Waking only moments later to two mostly missing slices, he said he was slammed and doing everything just to make it, and if I called during the week he could take care of me?? And he was "(?) and Algerian and he's trying to be nice to everyone?" Idk am I tripping?
author: Hayden J.

description: The pizza in the restaurant that's ready to be reheated is just ok. I've had delivery to my place that's very close by and the delivered pizza was 5 times better! Their wings are super salty so skip those. Great that it's also open late for the late crowd.
author: Miko L.

description:
Ordered a 6 pack of Diet Dr. Pepper, got regular Dr. Pepper instead. Ordered cheese tortellini, got fettuccine alfredo instead.

The food was cold, the fries were soggy, the burger was bland and the bun was hard. Too bad we didn't try the pizza. We won't be coming back.
author: Jon C.

description:
Let's start with my opinion about pizza- I love it. Hot, cold, with or without ranch- bbq sauce- I'm open to ideas and manipulations of the delicious pie. 
This was my first and only time I'll ever order from Piccolo. Ordered at 1130 on a Friday night- I know it'll take a while- 70 minutes pass and my two pizzas are delivered. 
Delivery guy was nice- no complaints there. 
Now for the storm- both pizzas were terrible. The crust was flavorless- texture was decent- crunchy & thin-ish.The sauce tasted like it was out of my middle school cafeteria. Cheese was also bland and lackluster- we even had feta on one of the pies- still terrible. 
I tried it with ranch, and even tried it cold and reheated today to see if maybe I wasn't "feeling" it last night. NOPE. Still tasted awful. 
Toppings were redeeming, I peeled their Canadian bacon off and ate it alone- at least I got some protein. 

I've eaten A LOT of pizza in my life- this is close to one of the worst tasting experiences I've had. I sure hope I caught them on a bad night.
author: Michael C.

description: TBH this place is good but just the fact that it took 2 hours for the delivery guy to get here is not acceptable I also called the guy that was answering the phone and ask how long my pizza would take and was really rude never buying from this place again.
author: Jose T.

description: Cheap, thick slice with a nice crispy crust.  Chicken pesto slice was quite tasty. Not the best but far from the worst.  Extra star for nice folks and being one of the few reliable late night options in the area :)
author: Rushil R.

description: I enjoy the pizza slices here!  Especially on late nights after a show.  The crust is really good - it's light and crunchy, the perfect balance.  The location is a little dodgy.
author: Lawree S.

description: I love this pizza place, they are never cheap on cheese ^_^ and crust is so buttery definitely my pizza stop.
author: Leslie H.

description: i made an order today on valentines day on eat24hr.com i told them to leave a note which was a big thing for me i even reconfirmed with eat24hr customer chat so they wont forget but they still did. this is really upsetting because the whole point of my order was to give the pizza and that simple freakin note to somebody
author: Gliann P.

description:
What this place is not: gourmet Italian. Every bad review is someone expecting it to be something other than midnight drunk food. It's not even the Olive Garden. But that's okay! It's not intended to be. Here's a restaurant you go to after the bars to have something soak up that alcohol. It's your quick and dirty carb fix.

I had a slice of pepperoni pizza and it was similar to Blondie's: oily, oozy cheese, crisp pepperoni and thick, doughy crust. Perhaps slightly undercooked crust, but satisfying and perfect as a digestif, so to speak.
author: Diane Y.

description: Amazing pizza and amazing people, always very welcoming . Probably the best pizza I've had in SF
author: Sammi K.

description:
Stayed at a nearby hotel this place was amazing! Got the Roma pizza, highly recommend. Staff super friendly, didn't wait long, can even call ahead to order. 

Order by slice or order full pizza!
author: Sherry R.

description: Awful, just absolutely awful. Terrible, insincere, patronizing, and inept service. Do yourselves a favor go somewhere else. Waited forty five minutes after promised 'a really nice table' in the first ten minutes of waking through the door.
author: elena b.

description:
For some reason it seems impossible to get a pizza delivered to Lower Nob Hill in less that 90 minutes, so we're trying everyone out. Piccolo is good for a late-night slice in the TL so we placed an order. 

The guy taking the order told us "less than 45 minutes," which is great. Well, an hour and fifteen minutes later, our pizzas finally arrive. Both are ice cold: it was like they delivered us our own leftovers. And they're super skimpy with toppings. 

Really disappointing on every level. If you're coming out of Great American or White Walls, it's a good slice. If you want delivery, look elsewhere.
author: That Was A Good Drum Break ..

description:
pizza is only ok.  BUT by far, my favorite place for cheese steak. SO GOOD. the only thing that would make it better is if they added mushrooms. 
I also love their cheesy garlic bread.
author: Lily Z.

description: Only cool thing about this place is the view. It is truly awesome. Seals, diving pelicans, kayakers and more nice stuff. However when it comes to food and service it is not good.
author: Phil P.

description:
This'll probably be the weirdest review I'll ever write.

First off, I technically didn't have any food here. I had a giant dinner of crabs and Chinese food before I came, and I was not drunk enough to indulge in more food (I can't believe I actually turned down food that was right in front of me). 

Anyway, my friends and I were at a bar and a guy came next to us with boxes of pizza and fries. My friends inquired where he got it from, and the bartender was nice enough to share some of her fries with my friends. They didn't eat yet, so we left to go check it out.

Walking up in the general direction of the place, we saw this guy with a box similar to the gentleman in the bar. We inquired again to where it was, and the guy pointed us happily toward the famed establishment, with a mouthful of pizza. 

Finally getting to the place, it was a bit busy for it being 12:30 am (probably normal for this place), and they had a bunch of pizzas just sitting out under the lamps. They looked really delicious, but I don't know why I didn't eat. My friends ordered the chicken/spinach and pepperoni pizza, along with a bunch of fries. They kept announcing how good the food was, but I was still full of food, sleep-deprived, and buzzing. Not a good combination, because I was barely able to stomach what I had already indulged in. 

Bottomline: I really wish I would have came back sober and hungry. I need to. I can't believe I actually wrote this review.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
Beautiful music.

Not sure what a flute has to do with Tenderloin pizza: http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/piccolo

But the guy making my chicken Parmesan sandwich (marinara sauce, grilled chicken, cheese) did so like a talented musician perfecting a piece. Extra large in size and in taste.

It was beautiful. Especially for $6.

Pizza doesn't earn as high marks. Slice of cheese that had been sitting there for a while and warmed up. $2.50 was reasonable. Tasted fine. Wish I could say more.

Can't say enough about the sandwich.
author: Jason B.

description: I used to go here until one night a huge rat came scurrying into the customer area from the rear room when the door was opened. I was in there with two other customers and we started freaking out. The guys behind the counter totally ignored us as if this was their pet rat and it was no big deal. One of them actually mocked the way I had screamed "oh my god!" The rat eventually ran back into the back room and someone there closed the door behind it. That was so f'ed up, I cringe every time I pass by this place. I now imagine that back room is filled with rats they milk for cheese. DISGUSTING.
author: N. L.

description:
I ordered a pizza from and it took just under two hours to arrive.  I called to ask about my order and they weren't apologetic and said they didn't have the driver's phone number- what a joke!  When my pizza arrived it was dry as a bone.  

DON"T order from here!!
author: Steph Y.

description:
I placed an order for delivery: chicken fettuccine alfredo, as well as with the chicken tenders to share amongst a few people.   

Turns out they decided to send me Spaghetti and meatballs. 

Now, I can understand that there might have been a miscommunication between what I ordered and what arrived at my door, I'm sure they were busy or something I can understand that, but nothing could have prepared myself for the disaster my taste buds experienced that night.

This pasta was so horrible I almost thought someone was playing a joke on me, literally the same consistency and flavor as a can of Chef Boyardee. There were two small meatballs total that were sitting on top of the pasta, and they were so sad looking that it made me depressed. It seemed as if they were frozen solid, then cooked in the microwave until burnt. 

The chicken tenders were actually 8 small nuggets that can be found in any grocery store freezer section, on top of a bed of stale fries that was probably purchased in the same aisle. 

The delivery time for my order  was reasonable at 45 minutes (delivered to one block behind the place, Geary st). 

It's possible that they were short staffed in the kitchen that night, but unfortunately I won't be ordering from here in the future as a result of my experience.
author: David M.

description: Do not order from here. I order pasta and there was chicken in it when i ordered it without(I'm a vegetarian) and then when i was eating the salad i got with it i found a thick black hair in it. Im blonde.  Plus when I called back they were extremely rude to me.  They lost a costumer.
author: Chelsea S.

description: The nicest staff they always welcome me and they have great pizza! I have no complaints everything taste yummy and they are fast too. :)
author: Anneke B.

description: Too much bread on my Philly cheesesteak! Could use more meat! Flavor was amazing though and same goes for the chicken Caesar salad. :)
author: Evangelou R.

description: Great service and the quality of the food is consistently good. My favorite pizza is their chicken, spinach and feta cheese.  The pizza is thin crust style and very generous slice.
author: Ferial R.

description:
This pizza place knows what's up. They offer entire pizzas or by-the-slice at a decent price. $3 for a large slice of pepperoni at 2am. Sold!

The people working the counter and oven were really nice. They had everyone in and out in no time and were extremely nice to all the drunkies. I'm sure they are well aware that all of us out drinking on the weekend make up the majority of their clientele.

Now, the pizza isn't spectacular. It's about a step up from a Jack's frozen pizza. At least that's how the by-the-slice was. Their specialty orders could be better/fresher. But I'm a fan of Jack's, so this made me happy. I just needed something to eat and this hit the spot.
author: Ericka A.

description: Really gross. Everything I ordered tasted terrible and was cold, yes cold. Not warm. Not hot. Cold. Last time for me.
author: Michael K.

description:
Their 'deep dish' is not a deep dish pizza even though its called that in the menu. It's a stuffed crust with mozzarella inside it. The center crust is thin. 

The pizza I ordered was so thin and soggy that it fell apart when I picked up a slice. Disgusting soggy pizza.

I called and told the manager and he said it was an employees fault and he would make it right. And he did. The second pizza was a vast improvement. And delivered ontime.
author: MIke S.

description:
What do I think of Piccolo Pizza? This YouTube clip pretty much sums it up: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q_c7SbkGaLk
Is that the old hag in "The Princess Bride" shouting "BOOOOO! BOOOO!" as Buttercup walks down the aisle? Yes, yes it is. Because that's exactly my reaction to Piccolo Pizza. BOOOOOO!

Ordered a greek salad and added chicken breast for an extra $2, angel hair pasta with tomatoes and onions, and tiramisu. Instead, my roomie and I received:

-caesar salad with chicken, DRENCHED with dressing -- dressing was so thin and watery that the lettuce and croutons were soggy. I had figured I'd get chicken breast that would then be sliced and served on top but instead got cooked chicken chunks. Not too big of a deal except they were overcooked and dry... I'm guessing they just heated up the pre-cooked chunks-o-chicken they use as pizza toppings but the extra step was unnecessary -- thanks to the heat-y chicken, the parmesan shavings melted and coagulated to form a weird, sweaty disk of cheese. On top of a salad. Grasping for eloquence but the only word that comes to mind is 'barf-tastic.' 

-spaghetti with marinara. Either they don't know the difference between angel hair and spaghetti, or they were lazy and didn't bother to call me to say they were out. Because maybe I wouldn't even notice the difference!!!!!!! Dude, I did. And I wouldn't have cared so much if you hadn't cooked the shit out of it. 

-tiramisu. I'll let you know how it tasted later. Unfortunately, it's frozen solid at the moment. 

When I called the tell them about the errors and request a refund, the guy said there wasn't anything he could do because I had prepaid for it via GrubHub. Then he told me to call the next day. It's very possible that the refund process is more complicated for GrubHub orders, but his tone and "call back tomorrow" felt extremely dismissive. He kept asking why I was requesting a refund -- BECAUSE YOU TOTALLY EFFED UP MY ORDER, that's why. I didn't even bring up the issue of quality. I hope all will be resolved but after reading a few of the other reviews here, I won't hold my breath.

But refund drama aside, that salad of theirs.... good god. Every time Piccolo Pizza serves that salad, a baby unicorn dies.

UPDATE: GrubHub refunded the order. And there was much rejoicing.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Two hours for my delivery to arrive, on a slow Monday night. I had to call and check on my order since it'd been an hour and a half. When the pizza finally arrived, after two hours, they'd forgotten my free bottle of soda. Ridiculous. I could have literally baked my own pizza from scratch.
author: Kicker ..

description: Horribly slow with my order. 30 mins late. When I called to ask about the order the just said the delivery guy left so just wait and hung up on me. When I finally got my order Not only was it room temperature, they forgot all condiments that i ordered. The food isnt even that good. The pasta looked and tasted old. Needless to say I will never use them again.
author: Lacey H.

description:
Very very doughy pizza, if that's your thing.  Toppings are pretty sparse.  

For a pizza joint located in the heart of the TL, $24 for an extra large is a bit much, not to mention to grimacing and customer-ignoring guys out front.
author: C L.

description:
Wow--what a horrible experience.  I have ordered delivery three or four times and each time has been worse and worse.  I like that they're open so late so I ordered a burger, fries and chicken nuggets last night.  The guy on the phone was so rude to me and yelled "about 45 minutes!" and hung up.

I got my order about an hour later and got a hamburger instead of a cheeseburger and had jalepenos on the burger instead of on the side and the chicken nuggets were seriously something from the frozen aisle @ the grocery store.

I called because I didn't want to be charged for one thing if I got another and the guy told me to suck it up and get over it, it's only 50 cents.  I agreed but said it's the fact that I didn't get what I ordered and he just kept telling me to get over it, get over it it's only 50 cents.  Then he hung up.  When I tried calling back three times in a row, my call was ignored.

I'm going in when they open with my half eaten order to get my full money back.  What a crappy crappy experience.  I'd rather spend an extra $5 or $10 and just order from Sparky's.  And I think you should too.
author: Patrick G.

description: This little pizza place in the tenderloin really surprised me. The staff is very quick and courteous and the food is pretty damn good and well priced. I usually get the pizza sub sandwich and add jalapeños to it, awesome portion for the price of 7 dollars. The meatball sandwich is excellent as well. Honestly never had the pizza but it looks good lol. For a late night spot or a quick lunch on the go this place is surprisingly good. 4 stars because it's in such a harsh location with crackheads and drug fiends all over the corner, but that's just the TL.
author: Zino M.

description:
Piccolo is bomb bomb bomb. Their pizza primarily, and it seems like they have unending fresh hot slices. The only thing that hasn't thrilled me here so far was their pasta sauce, but now I know to come here for the pizza (which rocks my world). The guys who run the place are super friendly and mellow too.

Now, on a personal note: Will everyone please stop knocking the Tenderloin? Yes, I'm aware that people sh*t on the sidewalk. Yes, my friend's car got broken into and cleaned out while it was parked right in front of my house overnight. Yes, I wouldn't hang out stationary outside of my house for more than two minutes. But I just moved a half block away from Piccolo (in the not-Polk direction, to, as I like to call it, the Friendliest Block in the City) and I dig my neighborhood, so please keep the HaterAde to a minimum. And watch your step, there's poo on the sidewalk.
author: Kyveli S.

description: Piccolo Pizza was fast, friendly and served wonderful pizza. We had an event at the nearby Great American Music Hall and had 55 hungry teens who quickly gobbled up the pizza. Thanks team at Piccolo.
author: Michele L.

description: I have eaten here many times and recently found out that its NOT zabiha halal and they say that they are a "halal" serving restaurant
author: Namal R.

description:
I ordered a pizza online at 2:07am. At 2:47am I called to see if my pizza was on it's way. They said they never received an order and that they were closed, put me on hold an took an order.... while I could hear the whole thing.

They didn't return to my call. I had to call back.

I called back and they said they were closed and weren't taking any more orders. I said, "I just heard you take an order while I was on the other line."

They said, well, that was their last order. I said, "But I called you first and you told me to hold."

It just gets worse from there. Their pizza is mediocre at best and their service is horrible and obviously their online ordering system doesn't work.

If it's late at night and you want pizza, go somewhere else.
author: Brian G.

description: It's a nice cheap place to grab something when most other places close. Not really a place you would make a trip, but a place for locals who don't want to travel far for food.
author: Brandon T. L.

description: So i order a pizza and some wings today through Foodler. I order a San Francisco pizza which comes with sausage feta and olives. What i get is a pizza with salami ,onions,and green peppers. So i call Foodler and they call the restaurant to make things right. The next pizza i get has spinach and mushrooms on it. Piccolo claims its made the right way and will not refund my money. Apparently they dont know how to read their own menu. And aside from that their wings are fatty. Probably the worst wings ive ever had. Foodler to their credit has given me the 15 dollars back in food bucks. I will stick with Foodler but this restaurant is a joke.
author: Mike W.

description:
It took over 1.5 hours to get delivered, I was still nice enough to tip. The food was completely cold and in addition to that they managed to get the order wrong as well! When I called back to complain, they seemed more offended rather than trying to come up with a solution.

Never again!
author: Tobias B.

description:
We live across the street. It's a half block drunken stumble between getting out of the cab and the front the door of our building. 
The guys there are almost all very friendly and know that I'm gonna get pesto pizza with pineapple on it and that my partner wants the chicken.
Chatted with some strange characters at Piccolo's in my time, but it's all a part of the overall vibe/experience. 
Their pizza is awesome, their service is great and there's never much of a wait. It doesn't get much better than that for your friendly neighborhood pizza joint.
author: Amy P.

description: It wont taste bad when your ass drunk after finding a hooker on the corner.
author: Justin S.

description:
This corner of Larkin and OFarrell is the physical boundary between your "Polk St Bar Hopping Adventure" and your "Le't go Check Out the Tenderloin Adventure".

Piccolo's pizza might as well have a sign up to quote the great Gandalf the Gray and say "YOU SHALL NOT PASS!".  You're really in the 'hood now.

I can see this place from my house, so I do patronize this place, but indeed, I do not pass any further.  And neither shall you.  

You've had a wonderful evening-- and you made it here before 3am when they close.  You're here because there is nothing else open, and you know damn well as I do that this would not have been out top choice had it been 3 in the afternoon.  Hey, but it is what it is, and it is 3am.  This is one of the best fresh-baked goodies you'll find (aside from the crack cooking up right outside the door) that you'll get your hands on using these green notes backed solely by the good faith of the United States of America.
author: Eugene L.

description:
ordered chicken parm sandwich and a deep dish pizza.
boyfriends opinion on the parm sandwich was 'nothing is right with this thing', it was just a fat soggy bun comprised mainly of sauce.
and the deep dish pizza was by no means a deep dish crust. just a flat pizza dough with a huge fat crust on the edge that was either stuffed with cheese or under cooked. i absolutely cannot believe i paid extra for what they consider deep dish.
never again.
author: Loralyn S.

description:
I was craving Little Star last night but, seeing as how they don't deliver, I had to find another option. I would have never heard of Piccolo, but I just happened to have swiped their menu off someone's doorknob as I was walking along Pine Street earlier in the day. I noticed that the menu includes a deep dish option...perfect timing.

Well, this is most certainly NOT a deep-dish pizza. But it was still pretty good for what it is. The crust was thin in the center and puffy around the edges. As I chewed on the outer crust, I thought "Hmmm...this is good!" So I picked at another piece and realized that there was cheese in there. Works for me!

If I didn't have Za and Victor's, I would definitely order from here again. It's a cheap but tasty pizza, delivered fast and piping hot. Like Domino's, but not really.
author: Valeria R.

description:
Great business & pizza! After moving to SF, we desperately were trying to find a delicious delivery pizza spot so we eventually found Piccolo's! 
Pizza's delish, salads are cheap and big, and they always deliver on time. 
What's even better is they care about you as a business. I.E. When my drunken roommate (who shall remain unnamed....) forgot to pay one night- Piccolo's graciously  waived the charge after I called again and had no idea this had happened. 

Thank you Piccolo's! You rock!
author: Jenna M.

description:
This place is terrible.  I got the worst food poisoning in my life here, a few years ago.  It's been a while, so I figured the health inspector has probably been by a few times since then.  They must have the same employees though, because they don't care at all about service or quality.  When I ordered last night, my food came very quickly, but I ordered chicken strips and got cheese sticks, and the chicken parm sandwich was shockingly bad.  It was a cheap round bun that you'd see on a school lunch, with a thick coating of mayo, a scrape of chicken, and American cheese.  The fries were cold.  I was hungry, so I ate what was basically a mayo sandwich, but I would have been embarrassed NOT to complain if someone were with me.  
Now, the best part:
This morning, I went downstairs to do laundry, and there was a perfectly normal-looking chicken parm sandwich and fries dropped down my basement stairs!!  What the hell, Piccolo Pizza delivery guy.  Where did you get the 2nd sandwich??
author: Corinna R.

description:
The pizza here is fine, i.e. does the trick when you're drunk.
They make a really good cheeseburger though!  It's big and comes with the works, all super fresh, and a giant heap of fries, all for about $6.  I don't think you can get a burger and fries at Mickey D's for that price, and certainly not this good!
author: Jannea T.

description:
Pros: Greek salad is tasty.

Cons: It took over 2 hrs to deliver a pizza and a salad, but if you want to go there to pick it up, the pizza joint is in the heart of the TL. This isn't Detroit, man. I don't want to get shanked while getting a pizza!
author: Taylor C.

description: Used their ATM to take out $100.. except it didn't give me any cash and still took money from my account. I told the manager and he said tough luck. Avoid this place.
author: Paul S.

description:
this is a review of a delivery order

pepperoni and mushroom pizza
- this was actually pretty good. and if I was going to review them on just their pizza, they would get a thumbs up. i really like that the mushrooms had a distinct flavor and the bite to the crust.

philly steak sandwich
- this is is a bit my fault i should have read more closely and noticed that cheese was not mentioned in the ingredients and there wasn't any in the sandwich. and because there wasn't cheese, the sandwich was dry. with the exception of this, the ingredients were the right ones but without cheese the sandwich just wasn't very good.
chicken wings

chicken wings
- the wings were very very dry.

the delivery was prompt and polite.

i will order from them again for pizza. and maybe a couple of their pizzas will make me forget the rest and i can go from dislike to like.
author: Mark D.

description: Worst service ever!  I ordered 2 pizzas and only received one!  The deep dish pizza is NOT deep dish, it's basically like a thin crust pizza!  DO NOT go here!
author: Michael D.

description: Love this place!! Great food, great people, great prices! I would double think delivery during weekends, I'm not the only one who loves this place
author: Moses K.

description: Aside from having to finish my wife's sandwich, (which was delicious) alongside my own fantastic Roma pizza, no complaints. The pizza was thick and juicy, and seemed fresh. The people seemed nice as well.
author: Seth T.

description: I ordered from Piccolo via Grub Hub and I have to say I'm disappointed.  I ordered the Shawerma, Gyro plate, Burger and Onion Rings.  Everything tasted like it came out of a microwavable box.  The gyro was dry and didn't even taste like meat.  It was more like one of those soy wanna be meats.  I can't say I'm going back for more.
author: Eileen L.

description:
My husband and I popped in here real quick last night before a show at the Great American Music Hall. The only other place I've been to that reminded me of this hole in the wall was another hole in the wall pizza joint in New York.
There really needs to be more pizza-by-the slice restaurants in northern CA. Not just Pizza My Heart or Pizza Shmiza. I'm talkin' REAL pizza.
For $11.75, we got two cheese slices, an order of onion rings, a Vitamin Water, and a bottled water. Not too shabby. The place is real small and right behind the counter you can see the pizza making station, the oven, and a deep fryer. The menu also had entrees such as pasta and chicken parmigiana and I wondered where they make the fancy stuff. Anyway, the cheese slices were classic. They were thin, did not fit on the paper plate it was served on, greasy, and oh so cheesy. It was so good. I really wish there was a place within a 20-mile radius from my house just like this. The onion rings were not just crispy but had grit. Good grit. It had a satisfying crunch to it. The ranch they gave us was not nearly enough for the onion rings so we asked for more. The guy told us it was $0.50 but he ended up just giving it for free. So we stuck a $1 in the tip jar. If I'm ever near here again, I'm definitely coming back.
author: Lara E.

description: Pretty good for the price. Quick and large portions. Great for drunk food that isn't junky. Recommend just grabbing the good to go. The restaurant is not very suitable for dining in. Their garlic bread is huge for the price!
author: Carrie T.

description:
As a former East Coast resident the pizza is on par with Domino's. HOWEVER, when I come home really drunk and think I might die if I don't eat, Piccolo is by far the best pizza and mozzarella sticks my taste buds have ever encountered.  They are great!  I was calling weekly at one point and they always remember me. One time I think they knew I was especially drunk and didn't bother delivering, which is good because I was passed out on the couch.  Or maybe they did, either way I wasn't blacklisted.  I believe they didn't because when I called afterward I was like hey!  Last time I called you guys didn't come and they apologized, half jokingly, I think they knew.  The pizza is also not too messy which works since I have woken up to my cat dragging slices from the box.

The prices are good and seriously the mozzarella sticks are the bomb, they usually-always bring red sauce but one time I swear they brought some white sauce, maybe ranch.  

On principle I can't give it four stars (it gets 3.5) because, well, it will never be NY pizza and NY pizza is the best!!
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
This is drunk pizza, not sure if I would come by if  I was sober.  The pizza has got a decent amount of crust, a pizza sauce not too acidic, plenty of greasy cheese, and with lots of meat to soak up all the drinkage. 

And it's pretty cheap! Perhaps I'll end up here again...
author: Lauren S.

description: Yayayayayayaya!! This place is great. Cheap food, good portions, really good, and cheap. Yes, I said "cheap" twice. We got a burger and fries for 5 bucks and it was just as good as any other. If anyting, it was better than any other. The burger actually tasted like a burger and the fries were good. Yes, the neighborhood is a little "iffy" for some poeple but it's not that bad. Just go there and grab a burger.
author: Dylan T.

description:
We all have varying pizza-type tastes. Lately, mine tend to be on the comfort food side more than the gourmet side. Piccolo's pizza crust is not too thin, not too think and not gooey and underdone like some pizza crusts of this style can be. 

There have been a couple of times in the last 5 months that my order came slightly different than what was requested (wrong flavor of Gaterade or a forgotten side of jalapenos) but the folks at Piccolo always make up for it with a free drink, salad, or the usual very hospitable and friendly service. 

My suggestion is to reheat using a toaster oven. Nice and crispy.
author: Beverly K.

description:
I still think this pizza is better than a lot that I have had (for delivery), but lately, every time I order from them, something is forgotten. I ordered mozzarella sticks which I assumed came with a side of marinara, but since I requested 4 sides of ranch (my friend and I both like ranch on our pizza), I got no marinara. I also only got one side of ranch (in place of the marinara). 

Also, before we had gotten a pizza that was crushed on the side of the box and this last time, the same thing happened, but not nearly as bad-it was still edible. I am convinced that it is the same driver both times and I don't know if it is how he places it in the car or how he carries it or what, but I like my pizza round, not flat on one side!! 

I think I would order from here again, but I would check before the delivery guy left to see if my sides were here too and make sure to double request them!
author: M M.

description: Oh why, did I just go ahead and order, before looking at Yelp first?! Spaghetti Bolognese tasted like left overs. LIke they made up a batch of pasta, mixed it with the sauce a few days ago, then scooped it into the container then heated it in the microwave. Another reviewer said Chef Boyardee, yeah, that too. The Chicken Fettucini pasta had a fishy taste. Waste of $40. Never again.
author: Sheviche R.

description: In from out of town and wanted to get food delivered since the drive was so long. Ordered the lasagna it came completely cold. The cheese in the inside was stiff and gross. No flavor at all!!! ALL our food came extremely cold!!! Our chicken cesar salad came soggy and the dressing was watery. So upset with this choice. DELIVERY TAKES FOREVER!!!
author: Brittni P.

description:
Hamburger with Fries - Fries were soggy and hamburger buns were hard.

12 piece chicken wings - not too bad.  Very juice and tender and decent in size.

First restaurant I ordered from that I had to walk (oooh a whole 4 flights) down the stairs to get the food while the delivery guy waited outside.  He also grabbed the wrong box and had to run to the car to grab the right one.  All to go boxes were very flimsy and weak and if I didn't watch out my food would fall out.
author: Walerz B.

description:
Just ordered for delivery from Piccolo...

Pizza came early - estimate was 45-60 minutes, it arrived within 39 minutes.  I ordered a medium half cheese, half sausage/mushroom, with tax, tip, free delivery and a free salad, the grand total was about $21.  Definitely not what I'd call gourmet, but it was hot, tasty and did the trick.

I'm full now.
author: Burrito M.

description:
If poor service could be converted into a clean, renewable source of energy, the Bay Area would never want for power again.  Hippies would spend their days languidly smoking weed and having filthy, unwashed sex with each other, content smiles erupting through their stupor as they realize the planet's survival is ensured eternally by Piccolo Italia Pizza.

They got my order wrong.  Not like "Oh they forgot to give me garlic sauce" wrong, but "What the hell is this unholy monstrosity of toppings on my pizza?"  At least, I think it was wrong; the quality was so miserable each topping looked like the same writhing mass of charred, blackened misery.  Is it an olive?  Sausage?  Pepperoni?  Diced pigeon scraped off the street?  The world may never know.  Every bite caused my throat to clench in terror, my very body rebelling against the foul concoction being forced into it.  Tears stream down my face, my stomach roiled in agony.  I literally threw up after eating.

Remember the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles cartoon?  Remember how the pizza had the consistency of rubber and flopped about with all the grace of a quadriplegic tumbling down stairs?  This pizza achieved such lofty heights of craftsmanship.  Seriously, it looked like it was out of a cartoon.  I expected it to bust out a top hat and cane and start prancing about performing show tunes at any moment.

This review was about service, though.  It's abysmal.  Piccolo Italia Pizza should be tried in the Hague for crimes against humanity.  It took an hour and a half to get the pizza delivered, and the driver had this expression on his face like I'd personally kicked his dog in the junk when he arrived.  A pizza was hurled at me followed by the squeal of tires as he sped into the foggy night to continue his monstrous work.  I think I heard a cackle.

Don't eat here.
author: peter S.

description:
Merm.  I don't know what that means, but it's the word that comes to mind when I think of Piccolo Pizza.  They have cheap pizza, and their garlic bread isn't bad.  But the pizza is, well, gross.  And they only take cash for deliveries, which is a scam.

Why am I giving them two stars?  Well, I'm not sure.  I almost definitely won't be back, but giving them two stars now seems fairer and more realistic than giving them one star and forcing myself to give them another try.
author: John S.

description: Almost 3 hours to deliver a pizza!  I called an hour and a half in they said they were on the way, then called 30 minutes later and he said they forgot to make it and they'll do it now.  However the pizza was pretty good when it finally got here.
author: Doug B.

description:
I had a chicken and spinach pizza since the owner said only the chicken was halal.  It was good, not amazing, but ok.  I also was excited to learn the "ham" is actually turkey ham so the Hawaiian pizza is not made from pork (for those of you who think fake ham is a problem, you didn't notice last time you ordered it, did you?).  When I'm having a weak moment, I'm going to come back and try it.  Hawaiian is my favorite and I haven't had it in years.

The staff was speaking in Arabic with another customer about how/why I ordered halal.  The owner was smart enough to stop speaking about it, although his male customer was a bit slower to drop it.  Little side note for all multi-lingual folks: don't assume the languages your customers/people around you speak, you could get in BIG trouble.
author: Cara J.

description:
Oops! I just realized my review of them was still shitty, which is funny because they were coming to my house like twice a week until the day that I moved way out of their delivery zone. 

Piccolo's rewarmed slices are kinda eh, but if you get the whole pizza and they make it fresh, you get it while the cheese is still gooey and it's soooo delicious. 

Mmmm.
author: Nicole L.

description: Ordering food at 2:30am is amazing. Getting a calzone and a dozen wings with 2 liters of coke. $27.50. Eating half a calzone and half a dozen wings in bed to fill the empty spot in your soul like a fat girl on prom night. PRICELESS!!!
author: Michael T.

description: Walked in for a couple of slices, we had the pepperoni and the combo. Great crispy bases. Super quick and the young guy at the counter was very nice and polite. I'll be back!
author: Wendy C.

description: Simple good food. Not fancy. We got a slice of cheese pizza...thin crust, hot and crispy. Also had the spaghetti. Got the smaller portion which was more than enough and came with really tasty yet simple herb garlic bread. Washed down with a Pellegrino Limonata. All under $12.
author: Kai R.

description:
I learned long ago, after two failed attempts, that no good can come of drunk yelping.....

BUT...after a kick ass show and late night at the GAMH, (Great American Music Hall, for those not in the know) and an even later night at the Nite Cap for post show drinking,  I also learned that this place kicks ass for yummy, greasy junk food!

Good night....ummm, or morning I guess.
author: Drue C.

description:
Italian Pizza made by Arabs. That's almost as random as Indian Cuisine made by Germans.

Any whoo...

It's not the cover of the Pizza box that matters, it's what's inside that counts. 

The Pizza is fantastic and the burgers are delicious. The cashier is friendly and kind. The interior is quiet and peaceful. The treys are blue. The buns are warm. Sucullent Patty's. Fries are geasy. Open Late. The view is not new. Still five prostitutes waiting for me. Pizzeria accepts Visa and Mastercard. Hookers accept Cash or crack. The homeless stare. The outside is still the Tenderloin. Beautiful.  

4 thumbs up. 1 thumbs down for one bad experience where square bear took half an hour with my order and than told me if I didn't want to wait i should go else where. Some new guy, boo you! I come back if I want.  

They serve Orangina. :D. I love Orangina.
author: Sani S.

description:
I am a firm believer in the fact that all good things come in pairs. Hot female twins. Boobs. Sandwich places near your dorm room. Italian places that deliver to your dorm room. Other places that deliver to your dorm room...see where I'm going with this?

Piccolo Italia. Not Piccolo's with an S, just Piccolo. They hate it when you add an as nahmean?

Anyway yeah, Piccolo. As soon as I discovered Piccolo pizza, I don't think I ever ordered pizza from Pronto again. Don't get me wrong, I love me some Pronto, but Piccolo just one ups them in the pizza department. So pairs right? One Italian delivery place for Pizza, one for regular Italian food! And by regular Italian food I meant only lasagna cause I'm an unoriginal douchebag. 

Back to Piccolo. I'm pretty sure that I ordered a medium pepperoni and pineapple pizza from Piccolo with a 2 liter bottle of something at least twice a week. Yes, always pepperoni and pineapple. Yes, unoriginal douchebag. Bite me. :)
