I don't know what it was about that pizza, but it was hot, tasty and fresh every time without fail, and just like Pronto, always arrived sooner than on time, being carried by the coolest guy ever. Note that "coolest guy ever" is a general statement used to describe the guys who delivered for both Pronto and Piccolo. It is no one in specific, it is all of them.

 If you could bottle the essence of awesome permeating the very pores of these guys, you could sell it to lame-o pre-grad collar popping bro's wearing pink shirts, so they could finally have a taste of what really being cool ACTUALLY feels like.

So yeah, get pizza, sign credit card thing, tip lots even though I'm broke, high five Johnny Awesome the delivery champ, and partake on some preme-o late night pepperoni pineapple-y goodness.

Thanks Piccolo, for keepin' it real. Real fucking great.
author: Zack H.

description:
You might notice that this is my first positive pizza review ever.

Yes - the end of the world is nigh.

Kirsten has something positive to say.

*ahem...*

Holy Zac Efron this place is tasty!  

The chicken nuggets were, i can only imagine what god had in mind when he created them in his likeness.  (this was on the 8th day - most people dont know this).

Yes, there was ranch involved in this order.  And they give you some for free!  I mean, you know what this means to me, dont you?  Well - you get a couple, but i had to have like 6 of them so there was a small charge, but it was minimal.  The little cups they package it in are the perfect diameter and radius for shoving optimal chunks of pizza into - ensuring a 90% chance of looking like a total fat-ass.

It was the perfect nightcap for an evening of baking Christmas cookies while consuming near fatal amounts of Jim Beam.  A winning combination, let me tell you.

However, I woke up this morning and felt like my insides had stepped into the ring with Apollo Creed the night before. 

 I dont know if Piccolos had anything to do with this.  I'm really excited to give a positive pizza review, so i'm gonna place the blame on Jim.  This time.
author: Kirsten S.

description:
I love this pizza! 

 I have been here a handful of times and here are the pros and cons.

PROS:

Pizza by the slice or whole is priced to sell and tastes great!

Crust tastes awesome! 

Staff is really friendly and smiles a lot. 

They are open and deliver really late (like 3am)

Great location right down the street from Great American Music Hall (my fav venue in SF)

Liquor Store Across the street.

Restaurant next door lets you bring your own booze to drink on the low!

Strip joint across the street.

CONS: (Ok I actually mean more PROS but I'm gonna pretend!)

You can score drugs on this corner VERY easily. 

Prostitutes hang out around this area like white on rice. 

You can see some random street violence if you hang out for more than 15 minutes. 

There is some (all night) massage parlors that look pretty seedy right down the street. 

There is a marijuana dispensary called Sanctuary about a block away that has AWESOME edibles! 

Umm all in all this pizza joint and it's epic location has everything I want and nothing I don't (wait did I say that?). 

 I'll be back over and over and over again. This pizza is the BOMB and this neighborhood is my fav!
author: John Z.

description:
First of all, their pizza is really good... and by really good, I mean more than good enough for post-midnight pizza. People that are being picky at 2:00 am should pass out hungry and be smothered in their sleep.

Anyway, the FULL 5 STARS are due to the following tale...

I drunkenly ordered a pizza an hour before closing. An hour later (at closing time) when the pizza hadn't arrived, I called to inquire as to WHY NOT. It turns out that our doorbell is broken, and the poor delivery guy had come not once, but TWICE, and tried to ring our bell to alert us to the fact that he was standing on our porch with our order. Well, seeing as it was already closing time, and I have a heart of pure gold, I said "Don't worry about it, just cancel the order," to which the kind man on the phone replied, "No, no, no! It's okay! We'll come back!" 15 minutes later, the selfless delivery guy was on our porch for the 3rd time that night with a smile on his face, long after he was supposed to be home in bed. 

You won't find kindness like this very often in the world of food delivery... when you do, tip big.
author: Grant M.

description: So-so pizza by the slice, nothing to recommend the food except it's there, you pay, they give you food, you eat.  Friendly staff though.  When you give coins and bills to the local homeless people you hope they're honest about it and spend here rather than on crack.
author: Gil S.

description: Delightful late-night (or daytime) drunk pizza, if you know what I mean. Nothing soothes the savage alcohol-fueled appetite like a slice of pizza. And if you're in the 'Loin, you could do a lot worse. Warning: It's located on the corner of Crack and Head. So if you don't mind wading your way through a sea of colorful street crazies to get there, this is the place for you.
author: Jeff R.

description:
After the guy on the phone literally hung up on me, prompting a call back to finish my extremely simple order, a 50 minute wait for 1 large pizza a 2 liter of Diet Coke, and a delivery guy with a miserable comb-over, the girlfriend and i were delivered a luke-warm pie that lacked much discernible flavor.  

On top of that, we were delivered a 2 liter of REGULAR Coke, that disgusting, demonic sugar water, which I won't touch, instead of that lovely artificially colored and flavored cancer-causing diet water that I so desired.  Big time one-star.
author: Zach A.

description: I love all the guys who work there! There so sweet to me. I eat at there place every week. Cheap good food!! I recommend the salad & pizza :)
author: Alexandra A.

description:
My favorite pizza place near my apartment, Piccolo is open late and serves up a hearty slice of pizza. The crust is rich and the cheese is tasty. They serve other food, pasta, burgers, etc. That other stuff is mediocre at best. Stick to the slices and you'll do okay. 

Now, this place used to have so-so pizza, and I would have rated it 2 stars. The atmosphere at one point was horrendous, being in the TL and all. I was once approached by a young woman asking me if she knew me. She was pretty thug and possibly high on one thing or another. She kept asking me for a dollar and I kept telling her all I had was five, for my pizza. She insisted I knew her from High School, which was far from a possibility. Then I think she hit me in the back of the head. That's when the owner started to scold her. It's gotten much better here and I have yet to be hassled.

Once I ate here drunk and grabbed a shaker that I thought was cheese because it was in the cheese shaker. I dumped it all over my pizza slices. Turned out to be salt. I tried my best to eat it, but couldn't. I ended up taking the slices home and LITERALLY washing the salt off of the pizzas in my sink. But that was a long time ago and I am smarter now... I hope.
author: Aaron M.

description: Good pizza, good crust, good ingredients and always very satisfying.  Open late--hey why doncha grab a slice.  I always get combination.
author: Anon B.

description:
The name suits the place well. A tiny corner shop that serves the Italian dish of your choice. From pizza to pasta to sandwiches, this place had surprising variety. 
I came in here no expecting much at all. Just a quick filler upper before a concert down the street at the Great American Music Hall. I had the $3.50 slice of their chicken pesto pizza. It honestly really delicious. My buddies had a chicken primagio sanwich and combo pizza, they both seem to like their choices. 
The staff was really nice and helpful when taking our orders and quickly brought out our orders - well... except for my friend's sandwich but he thought we wanted that to go so he kept it warm for us in the oven.... that was nice :)
author: Danvin R.

description:
Ordered from eat24hours.com:

Ordered around 7:30 and food came around 8:00pm (not too bad for the timing). Food was still hot, delivery guy was really nice and brought it all the way up to my door (3rd floor). Food is good stuff. Got the veggie lasagna and half loaf of garlic bread. Lasagna was missing a little something but huge portions for the money for sure!
author: Jung-Ah Y.

description:
Starving and on my way to the Great American Music Hall, Piccolo's pizza was the best idea around, or at least the only visible place for a quick bite en route from our car. Pizza by the slice for standard fare, and though it satiated my belly, it left something more to be desired. Their sausage topping was a sprinkle of those tiny overly salty dog food pellets you find at most pizza places, and obviously we all prefer the less uniform sausage chunks one would find at a four or five star pizza place. Crust was too thick and doughy for my taste, and all around just barely satisfactory pizza. 

Perhaps their other non-pizza food options are better, and I'm sure I'd say their pizza is amazing if I was drunk late at night. Maybe I should've just eaten at the Great American Music Hall, but that would mean four drinks instead of six. I've had slices far worse, so I'd stop here again if it was convenient, but next time I plan to leave early enough to go to Victor's.
author: Tihani K.

description:
Eh..just an average slice of pizza. Would I go back sober.....probably not. Actually, I've been back sober.... unless I'm raving hungry...I wouldn't. On a drunken night staggering home from Swig....okay maybe. Nothing fancy, just an average pizza joint. Bleh....

2 Yummerz stars for me...
author: Ann T.

description:
The food here is good enough.  I usually just order a sandwich or a salad.

The good thing is that it's cheap and fast.  They also have something like a $7 minimum for delivery.  Can't beat that.

I'm gonna pretend I didn't see the review about handling the crackhead's money then the pizza!
author: King O.

description:
I've ordered delivery from this place many, many times. I finally ate at the actual restaurant about a month ago which was bright and clean with friendly service but basically a walk-in slice place. What makes Piccolo good is great value, especially their coupon meal deals. Just hang onto the menu and mention the coupon when you order. I've even ordered online. Also, they deliver late for all of you who need to soak up some of the night's partying or if you're a night owl like me. Some of their other menu items are good, too, especially the chicken wings and don't forget to ask for their bleu cheese dressing. Even if you don't get one of the deals, they often throw in some soda. I also like that the meat is halal - turkey Canadian bacon is pretty good on the Hawaiian. Probably can't hurt to save a few calories if you're eating pizza which is not something I really care about, but it also keeps the pizza from getting too greasy as my friends who introduced me to the place say.

I like this kind of pizza - chewy crust, lots of toppings, sauce that isn't too sweet, and lots of cheese. I've never been into the super thin crust of gourmet or NY style.

Only problem is that sometimes they forget something with your order or give you the wrong dressing, but they fix it or usually it's not too big a deal anyway.
author: Myla A.

description:
This place used to be an addiction.  A year ago they were making the best pizza in the city.  It was fresh, extra cheesy, perfectly cooked and only 2.50 for a large pepperoni slice. The grease from the pizza used to just ooze out of the pizza and was sure to give one an instant heartattack . . . but it was worth it.  It was almost as if they added a hint of cinnimon to the cheese which made it a masterpiece.

Things have changed now, the grease is gone and it tastes like any other junk food that attempts to be healthy.  I dont care what anyone says, diet Dr. Pepper is not as good as regular Dr. Pepper.  The pizza is now always heatlamp warm, overcooked, and dry as bone.  I used to make special trips to this place just to get a few slices, now I wont walk one block if I'm starving.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Piccolo is our walking distance pizza place. The food is awesome and [most] of the staff is incredibly friendly and inviting.  I love love love their pizza, the crust is awesome, not too thin, not too thick, and they do not put too much tomato sauce (which is something that I hate) on their slices. Their Hawaiian is my favorite. Once you have visited their shop a few times, they begin to recognize you and often include little perks. The bf and I go in there probably once a week for a quick lunch or bite for dinner. The owners are always offering us free drinks/French fries/etc. The hours are great (open late night -'til like 3am). The food beyond the pizza is good too - their Italian sub-style sandwiches are really good. I love the hot wings because they bake them in the pizza oven and they get this nice spicy, crusty chicken wing goodness coating on them.

The seating area is not huge, but only really gets crowded on Thurs-Sat. nights and after a show in the area has let out.
author: Megan M.

description:
It is close to my work so I always go there to get a slice. It is cheap and extremely good. 
Bad things: location...       not in a place place, and it is too small, so just grab your pizza and go home, or order delivery.
author: jaime b.

description: We were out late night after a show.  $2.50 for a cheese slice.  The neighborhood was bit sktechy but the place was clean and bright.  Pizza was a bit thicker than my favorite.  It was good though and folks there were friendly - I'd go back.
author: Jeff J.

description:
If you heard someone at 1 am yelling PIIIIICCOOLLLLLOOOOOO!! last night, that was me.

After a long night of photo editing, drinking, photos and more drinking some nice hot delicious pizza sounded ah-maaay-zing! Thank god this place was right next to my buddies place. Their slices to go were sooo good. Usually I like a ton of stuff on my pizza but we grabbed some regular cheese slices.. SO good! I've never been a huge fan of just cheese but it was so good. 

I won't lie.. some of my favorite slices I've had while living here thus far. I will be coming back! My apologies before hand if I'm a little drunk bear.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Beh.  This is the place to come to when you're broke and tired of Lee's Sandwiches or insanely drunk from the Edinburgh or Whiskey Thieves.  
The slices are decent but DON'T try the lasagna!  There was like, an inch of grease on top.  And as much as I love all things greasy, that shit was insane.  Blah.
author: Meh M.

description: This place is by far the best fast food/ dine in spot in San Francisco. It's not located in a wonderful neighborhood, but the food is delicious. I love their juicy hamburgers with loads of fries for only $5. It's cheap and quality food. And if you're Muslim or Jewish, the food is HALAL which is great. I definitely recommend people to go taste their food. Enjoy!
author: Moe L.

description: Decent pizza and sandwiches at reasonable prices. Nice staff. They have Mexican Coke with real sugar in the drinks-cooler, which is always a plus!
author: Vincent G.

description:
Given that SF happens to have as many pizza places as it does quarreling crackheads (and it seems those crackheads must be making the pizzas at some of these places), I was relieved when I got my order from Piccolo and it was actually delicious!

I tend to judge a pizza place, first, by its appetizers. If its appetizers aren't good, then I usually don't like the pizza if I even feel masochistic enough to order more. 

The mozzarella sticks are the bomb. Big, gooey, and fried up real nice. My first order of these came with ranch, which was a really good alternative to the marinara I got the next time I ordered. 

Their wings are awesome! I'm a buffalo wing aficionado and if a pizza place can get wings right, they're on their way to being earmarked for future orders from me. These wings were big, meaty, and had just the right amount of coating on them. Oddly, SF doesn't seem to have any straight up wing places, however, I really am encouraged by these ones. Usually pizza places either have tiny wings (the big chains) or those lightly breaded wings that are also tiny (Irving Pizza, blech). Not these! They were worthy of a repeat order, for sure.

The chicken nuggets are regular lunchroom fare, but it didn't put me off. At least they were done correctly.

I'll have to try the pizzas next time (today!).
author: Chris M.

description:
It doesn't take a lot to get 2 chubby 30+ guys to repeat a late night snack adventure after copious drinking, but when it happens on back-to-back nights with plans for a possible 3rd, you've got something to behold.

Piccolo Italia Pizza is conveniently located around the corner from places I apparently get completely f*$&@d up.  Based on other reviews, I'm wondering if it make actually be a hidden Atlantis for boozers, only appearing when you have reached the pinnacle of clarity that only complete shitefacedness can bring.

Based on my foggy memory, I recall what appeared to be a hodgepodge of humanity outside the doors here.  Folks with nary a tooth, folks with ivy league sweatervests - it was all on display.  The night manager was extremely friendly and had no problems selling us 2500 calories worth of late night goodness.  On night 2 he admitted that my friend reminded him of "The Great Bouhlah" back home, so he threw in a free drink as well.

The pizza was crunchcrustastic, but might've used a tad more tomato sauce in my humble inebriated opinion.  You can bet your bouhlah I'll be back here the next time I find myself zombified in the 'loin, though.  That is, if the magical portal to Piccolo opens for me once again.
author: Brett L.

description:
3/22 5 Stars
This place is greaaaaaat (: Piccolo's the first place where I had garlic bread with FRESH garlic on it & melted cheese . Mmmm~ Their deals are great-- worth the money . I'm currently waiting for my cheeseburger & I'll probably edit this post later . But, their pizza is good, tasty . My all-time first place I think of when I want pizza is Piccolo ^_^

EDIT on 3/23 Three Stars
- 1 star = They forgot the 2 Liter Soda that came with my deal .
- 1 star = This is the second time they forgot something .
I can't do half stars.. but if I could, I would because their pizza was dry tonight -__-" What's wrong, Piccolo ?!?!?!
author: Jenny Y.

description: Ordered at midnight n they delivered to our hotel rom asap! Super fast n good food for this late night. On our next sf visit we'll def revisit !
author: Wendy T.

description:
Pizza was good for a fair price.  It didn't take too long for a delivery either.  The crust was a little thick, but then again, I lived in NY for five years.

My friend got the Chicken Parmesean.  Excellent bang for your buck, but it wasn't a breaded cutlet, but rather cubes of white chicken.  Tasty though.
author: Lyz L.

description:
One large pizza and a free medium pizza for 3 people = $21 without tip!

You really can't find a better deal unless you're ordering from Domino's or Round Table.  And that's just a really bad faux paux if you do so.  The roommate ordered the California Style pie that came with sun dried tomatoes, artichokes and green olives.  It was sooo very yummy.  So-so on the cheese pizza.  It pretty much looked like it came from Domino's, but hey, it was free.

Overall, it's average pizza.  From the phone order to our door, I think it took all but 25-30 minutes.  The first time we had ordered from here, it was about the same.  It's definitely better than waiting an hour to an hour and a half with Mr. Pizza Man...I'm just sayin'!
author: Shane P.

description:
Most late night pizza places are crap, but this place is great.  

Their good ol american-italian style spaghetti with meat sauce (and sausage meatballs) tastes somewhat like what we used to make at home, and it's always served hot and fresh with some garlic bread.  The pizza isn't the best in the world, but hey it tastes great, and doesn't come to your door all soggy-it's fresh and hot. 

The guy on the phone knows what he is doing and doesn't screw up your order or make you repeat everything 6 times.  The delivery guy is friendly and always says a warm thank you when he's tipped.  He nicely apologized for being 10 mins late (at 2:30 in the morning!) but yet the food was still piping hot and fresh.

I've ordered from this place about 7 times now and not one bad experience yet.  This food is made with a decent amount of love and care and so it doesn't give you a weird stomach ache like when you go to some creepy place where there's rats and workers don't keep their hands clean.

Hot fresh pizzaria food from competant, friendly, honest  workers whom you can trust to satisfy your late night snacking.  Can't go wrong.

tenderloin area
Open till 2:45

yummmmmmmmmmmmm!
author: Mark K.

description:
stopped by to get some food with some friends yesterday since we were late and the others were done eating at Bang San by the time we got there.
the pizza shop has a variety of pizza options as well as sandwiches...
ham, pepperoni, sausage toppings are all beef but not zabiah... only the chicken is halal 
i got a slice of chicken to go... even though they put the slices back into the oven for a re-heat, it was pretty cold by the time i ate it  about 20 minutes later :)... the pizza was abundantly topped with chicken, cubes of cheese, and spinach
author: charlotte s.

description: Open from 11am to 3am. They're pizza isn't the best in the city, but at 2.50 for a quick slice of pizza at any time in the TL it's hard to pass up. One of my favorite places to munch.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
This is the second review of three, reviewing only a single cheese slice.

The I slices I have had have always been a little burnt on top, this is not necessarily a bad thing, the crust is superb, which is also importante, capiche? The place is a little bright for my taste kind of like safeway, and the condiments are sometimes hard to come by, I usually get the slice to go, because I AM A MAN ON THE GO!
author: wayne s.

description: I've only tried one thing here and I don't plan on eating anything else. The combination slice is ridiculously good.  It's a little cold in there at night, but that's common with most pizza spots.  Best pizza by the slice I've been to so far.
author: Fawad M.

description: Considering the dirty sketchy area its in, this place is awesome. Fries are bomb, chicken wings are bomb and the pizza is well BOMB!
author: Kalen F.

description: Cheeseburger was the shit! The fries were okay... They delivered to my work place. I will love to visit the restaurant myself.
author: Jenny H.

description: For the same $3, you can get a better slice of pizza at other places, BUT it's not bad. Also, both of the workers there were very friendly and nice to me and provided quick service. 2 stars for the pizza, 4 for the staff.
author: vishal k.

description: I really like Piccolo's pizza, but I'm also aware that it's a matter of opinion. The crust is very thick, so if you're looking for a New York style pizza don't stop here. They have some other food items, like hot sandwiches and chicken nuggets (from a bag, Tyson I think). If you've worked up an appetite from drinking all night on Polk st. or in the tenderloin, this is a great end up. With the friendly casual service and a minimal crackhead presence i find myself here quite often.
author: Grant F.

description: The worst lunch I have had in quite some time. My office mates and I put in an order and about 45 mins later the food shows up with out my sandwich. I waited for another 25 mins for them to drive back and pick up my cold dry and tasteless sandwich. Everyone knows french fries are horrible when they are cold.  I feel ripped off and will never go back or order there again. The only people who would like this food are drunk people.
author: Luke W.

description:
After walking Bay to Breakers in 4" heels, underpants, and not much else (hi, mom!), and then partying like a rockstar all evening, I woke up very hungry this morning. After finishing off last night's impulse-buy extra large pizza, and eating 2 cans of soup and a box of unchicken nuggets, I still found myself craving grease, salt, and sugar. With a side of sauce. 

These guys came to the rescue, but I'm not exactly thrilled with the results. Let me first point out that the customer service here ROCKS. Both the gentleman answering the phone and the very cute delivery boy (this is a Tunisian-run operation) were exceptionally friendly and very pleasant. It should also be noted that their prices are amazing and you'll be hard pressed to spend more than $20. My lasagna ($8) is HUGE. Like, it could feed 4 or 5 people easily. There are tons of fresh-tasting veggies in there and there's lots of nicely crisped cheese on top. It's extremely salty (and I *heart* salt), though and very acidic. On the upside, there is none of that freezer-burn taste so common among Pizza Delivery pastas. The mozzarella sticks ($5 for 6) were yummy but not as cooked as they could have been. A few minutes in the oven solved that. I also ordered Tiramisu ($3.25) in order to push my bill up so I could get a free 2 litre soda (on orders over $15). It's very good. 

I'd give them 4 stars based on the service and the short time it took them to get my food to me. I think it was about 35 minutes. But I'm going to have to 3-star them for now since even terribly hungover, the food wasn't that great. I really want to try their pizza and hopefully that will give me a legitimate reason to 4-star them for real.
author: Autumn K.

description:
i fell into this place completely hammered on sunday night and had an absolutely delicious piece of pepperoni pizza with hot sauce and parmesan cheese.  now, it may have been absolutely delicious because i was hammered, but my more-sober friend concurred with my review of its excellence the next morning.

also, very conveniently located near the strip clubs.  YUM PIZZA & PUSSY.

(just kidding i don't actually go to the nudie bars.)
author: calamity d.

description: While waiting for some work to be done at a local garage I stumbled onto this pizza joint. Walking in I had to pass two people in a heated argument out front. Come to find out, it was the owner yelling at the homeless loitering in front of the store.  AAHHH the Tenderloin. I had two slices of pepperoni and a coke for about 6 dollars. Standard pizza, nothing I would brave my way into the T-loin for.
author: Bucky K.

description: I've been ordering my pizza from these guys since the day I moved to SF. Good friendly service and their delivery is usually pretty quick. The best thing is their crust is just right, never too thin or too thick. They make it exactly as I like it.
author: Ryan H.

description: Really reasonably prices, delivers till 3 am, free delivery with a $10 spend. The Meat Lasagna is amazing and for $10 it can feed two.
author: Rich S.

description: I'm not sure how they allow this to pass as pizza. Also, we ordered blue cheese with our hot wings and got ranch instead.
author: Louis P.

description: Perfect for pretty decent pizza after you go out to the bars in Tender Nob or Union Square.  Probably only 3 stars if you're eating it before midnight.
author: Melanie C.

description: Warning, if you like hot wings with flavor dont get them here.  Pizza looked fine but for some reason my drunken colleauge and I were drawn to the idea of flavorful hot wings, we were sorely dissapointed..
author: Ian H.

description: I stay in SF once or twice a month for work and I always stay at the Cathedral Hill Hotel. Usually I get off work late and need something yummy and quick so we always get Piccolo delivered. The food always arrives really quickly, and the guys that work there are sooooo sweet ;) Most times I forget to tell them to bring Ranch while I have them on the phone, but somehow they always show up with it anyway!
author: Tori E.

description: $2.50 for a slice of pizza can go along way here. Honestly I really don't have to exactly explain how good the pizza was here. The slice is huge and the taste is amazing. Great family run business here. Support your local pizza!
author: Jon-o G.

description: I think I ordered wrong when it comes to toppings but the cheese and crust were delicious. They came quickly and were very nice!
author: Dana C.

description:
i like the fact that they'll give me free pop with my pizza, but i don't like that sometimes their prices aren't what they say they're going to be.  still, the pizza is fine, and i've been there and am not scared of what might be in my pizza.

that said, if they quote half an hour for a cheese calzone, it shouldn't take forty-five minutes.  especially since it's ten to fifteen minutes if it's takeout.  you can't argue traffic, because we live two blocks away.

wait, puck.  stop being lazy and go pick up your own pizza.

wait, yelp.  pizza-buying is only for special lazy occasions.
author: Puck F.

description:
OMG! Piccolo is so good! 

Had their pizzas before, but what really melts my butter is their black forest ham and provolone cheese sandwich! Ask for fries too, (*drool*) and not only will they bring over the Catsup, but they will also bring over the mayo
author: Art C.

description: Pizza isn't really anything to speak of at all but they deliver late (past 2am) so they come through in the clutch.
author: Tommy P.

description: This place isn't half bad as a lunchtime or late night fall back or even a regular spot.  They make some good sandwiches and their fries are good too!  Sometimes their ready slices are a bit old and so you may want to give them a good look prior to selection.
author: Derek D.

description: Okay, we just ordered a pizza (me, Erica and Whitney), and we think it will be amazing, and we also think that it will be a quick delivery.  We ordered 4 pizzas because we were so impressed by the service.  We love you (truth).  We love pizza (pizza is love, pizza is health, pizza makes me happy; more than you could ever imagine).  Thank you.
author: Erica W.

description: Easily the best pizza in the city.  Maybe the best I have ever had.  Even when it has been sitting for a while, after it is run through the oven it tastes fresh and is chronic.
author: CAPT i.

description: The pizza here was very disappointing, to be honest. Not enough tomato sauce with overcooked cheese and pepperoni. Not much left to say, except that I've had much better.
author: Tan E.

description: One of my two fav pizza places in the city! Their Californian (pesto, mushrooms, spinach, olives, etc) is incredible!! I have also gotten single slice pieces of vegetarian and cheese, which have always been delicious. But most importantly, their cheesy garlic bread is the bomb!!! I promise you, you can NOT find better garlic bread in the city!
author: Anne A.

description: Really good pizza when its fresh out the oven. Pretty awesome burger and fries. Awesome people who work there. My favorite pizza in the Nob Hill/ TL
author: edgar s.

description:
Thanks Mourad and all your team to be there !! Slices of pizza soooo good, cheeseburger better than in a fuckin' fastfood like Burger King , you wait maximum 5minutes to have something cheap but delicious !!! The workers are so friendly on top of that. 
Anyway i love this place and I recommand it to everyone !!
author: Julie B.

description: Hands down the best Philly cheese steaks I've come across in this town.  Plus, the people that work there are super sweet and accommodating.  Fast and speedy delivery.  Food is always fresh and halal.
author: sonya s.

description: This is my new favorite pizza place after one tasting. Sometimes it's all about timing. I tried calling my (now 2nd) favorite place Mythic Pizza on a friday night (or was it saturday?) but the phone just kept on ringing and ringing, well, lost business to ya, I'm so sorry! Piccolo's menu was hanging off my door, so I stepped outside and decided to give it a try. We ordered half and half, and some hot wings. Me and my friend were not disappointed, and we reached the consensus this was our new favorite late night pizza place. Delivery was equally fast, so all in all, I will definitely try it again.
author: Rogerio F.

description:
i like this place b/c (1) the service is very friendly (but not super fast, which is ok with me); (2) they make their meat ravioli without cheese; and (3) their meat sauce actually has a substantial amount of meat in it.  it's no brick oven pizzeria, but i'd take this place over the round table nearby.  besides ravioli ($8.50) and pizza by the slice ($2.50), the menu claims philly cheesesteaks, salads, and meatball subs.  the space itself is on the small side (maybe 2-3 small tables plus 4 stools at a counter in front of the window), but it's a great place to ppl watch during non-rush times.    

(and why are other yelpers pointing out that this pizza place is run by tunisian ppl?  so what?)
author: Zoe L.

description: After living in the TL for a while this place has become our regular quick spot.  From their delicious pizzas to the sandwiches and salads, the food is consistently fresh and tasty as I've never had a bad meal.  The employees are great, they know their regulars and treat them accordingly.  Prices are good for eating on a budget and being open past last call is always perfect for the late night dining.
author: Paige C.

description:
cheap. 

the greek pizza with feta was our regular. along with buffalo wings.

they deliver late night.
author: Rosalee C.

description: Well I have only had a slice of cheese pizza here a couple of times but I think it is above average pizza. Not the best I have had in the city but decent. I think it was only two bucks for a slice of cheese and it's a big slice. The crust is a little thicker than I usually go for but it taste good. I think the cheese on it was good too. Not a lot of sauce on it. They have burgers,chicken sandwiches,fries and onion rings too.
author: Jack B.

description: I love this place! I was actually headed over to Prime Dip Sandwiches like a block down from it but it turned out to be closed because I went on a weekend. Not so much of an oops on my place because I was walking down the street looking for a place to eat when finally I found this place to eat. I had to wait a bit because the cashier was having a conversation and he didn't want to be rude. He gave me a discount off the price because he made me wait. I got a burger and fries and I'm a huge fan of both and these were delicious! I got both straight off the grill and unlike most burgers, this one didn't get cold after two seconds! It's a small place, but nice. Girls, try going during the day or bring a friend if you're going at night because it's a little sketchy. Next time I want to try the philly cheese steak. They're huge! And the place is pretty cheap, a burger and fries for $5 and it's better than most burgers I've gotten which is saying something.
author: Robin J.

description: Even after O'Farrell St exploded in flames, Piccolo managed to satisfy my need for a slice. The Roma is fantastic. Service is quick and kind. Great job.
author: W C.

description:
Slow and cold food. I ordered chicken nuggets, fries, greek salad, and buffalo wings. 

This place is just a few blocks from my house and it took 1 hour and 6 minutes for the delivery from the time I placed my order.

The fries were cold and soggy. The buffalo wings and chicken were also cold by the time they got here. The only thing that was decent was the salad because

I will never get delivery from this place again. They really went downhill. Last year I would have given them 3 out of 5 stars.
author: g m.

description:
i'm waiting for my medium pizza right NOW and i realized i havent yelped this place yet!!

it's CRACKIN! this pizza is HELLA good! the crust is perfect. open late, cheap, delivery, and everyones super nice, complimentary, and they all practically know me by name now. every time i introduce a friend to this pizza they go crazy, and always wanna come back. 

mmmm so good.
author: Rachel J.

description: This Pizza is the bomb.  Wherever you are partying in the city, it is worth it to stop by this Pizza spot and get ur grub on.  Crucial late night meal, quality pizza that has saved me from hangovers.  Went back for lunch the next day also to keep the goodness flowing.  My favorite pizza spot in the city by the bay, and the staff is friendly and lively!
author: Seif F.

description: Piccolo Pizza is an overlooked part of the excellent corridor of cheap eatin' that you can find on Larkin between the Civic Center and O'Farrell.  Over the months I've lived in the neighborhood, this place has grown and grown on me.  I originally was hooked by their excellent garlic bread- cheesy and hot, and cut different by everyone who makes it.  It was so good, it took me awhile to bother to try anything else, but when I did, I wasn't disappointed.  Their pizza by-the-slice never has that 'hour old' taste that's so common.  Their crust is always nice and crispy on the bottom, but hot and soft in the middle, an excellent balance, and they're *almost* always friendly and fast with your order.
author: Harrison A.

description: Incase you want to know, the people who run the store are Tunisian. Great, friendly service; if you're a regular you can expect free sodas, and the pizzas themselves don't step a foot wrong.
author: Pat S.

description: my friend used to live on the same block as Piccolo pizza, and this was her favorite. i had it once and it was actually really good. it opens late and the slices are big and tasty. sorta greesy but whatever! get the regular french frices, they're super yummy as well!
author: Tiffany T.

description: These guys are always super friendly, whether on the phone or in person. They operate in a crappy neighborhood, but somehow manage to keep serving with a smile. Their pizza is above average, but not excellent. The real cool thing about this place is that they have a big menu and will deliver anything (including burgers).
author: Adam R.

description: I ordered 6 wings with BC dressing, one hamburger with Ketchup and Mustard only, and a piece of mousse cake-which brought me just over the $10 minimum and guaranteed me lunch for tomorrow.  I  ordered through one of those on line delivery portals that seem to only be able to sign up crappy restaurants like Paraat, Go- Getters, and the Front Room. The restaurants receive the orders in writing, so there shouldn't be any problems. Right? The delivery guy calls from his cell phone. He asks me to come wait by the door - while he parks his car!!!! That's a big, big, big, red flag that I am dealing with idiots. It's Saturday night. I live in the Theater District. He will not find parking easily. He doesn't know dick about door codes!  Anyway, I call the restaurant, and ask the lady to to call the driver. Tell him to use the door code when he gets here! He came in with one of my neighbors. I don't know what they are calling BC at Picccolo Italia, but it ain't salad dressing! This was a small container of warm, strangely flavored mily - looking water? It was white. Any, similarities between that substance and BC dressing ends there. The wings themselves were actually pretty good.  The burger had ONIONS, which I could smell the second I opened the bag. They weren't on the side (if they were I may have been able to avoid their taste), but on the burger itself. What does this mean? It means that my burger is going to taste like ONIONS! For all you people who work in restaurants, and just pick the onions off in situations like this and send it back out. People who hate onions, can still taste them! They have juice - you lazy people who shouldn't be working in restaurants in the first place! Simply picking the onions off does no good! It's called "cross contamination" just like with germs!  Anyway, I call back . The man who answered the phone can say "hello" in English  perfectly, and nothing else. When I finally get him to understand the problem. He gets flustered. I ask to speak to a manager or someone who  speaks English better than him He says - no one else is here. I say I know someone else is there  - I spoke to her less than 10 minutes ago! He says it again  and hangs up!! I call back.  He does it again! What the hell? I wait a bit, call again, the lady picks up. I explain the problem with the food, and about Mr. Hang up man. I can tell - it's not going to matter. Anyway, the guy uses the door code when he re-delivers the burger. It takes one minute for me to get to the door. I open it. He's not there!! He was sitting in his car! He comes up  with the bag. I close the door, turn around, and look at the sandwich.  I can't believe it! This  burger is prepared exactly the same way -  onions and all! I open the door. He's just getting into his, too expensive for just pizza money looking car.  I called him back up to the door. I ask him why this burger looks like the one I returned. He gives me this confused Scooby Doo looking stare. What's so hard to get about ketchup and mustard ONLY? When he finally understood the problem ('cuz it's sooo complicated) he gestures for me to just pick the onions off! I am furious by now. (Actually, I was full from the  wings - and furious! But, I could have cared less about the burger by then. Now, it's  just a matter of principle.  I would have paid for the right burger anyway.) I demand my money back on the spot, rather than let him leave with both bags like he wanted to do. He tries to grab for the bag in my hand, while pretending like he didn't have the 5.50. I'm like no way buddy. He finally coughs up 5.30 after much fumbling. Close enough! I gave him his 2 onion burgers back  and closed the door! Piccollo -never again!
author: ML G.

description: Ok so when it comes to the food, it's great... The pizza is a kick ass late night snack. However, since I live in the hood, I usually call in the order and walk down there if I'm not getting it delivered... The last 2 time I have called, my orders have been given to someone else!!! The 1st time this happened, another person was complaining about the same thing... I have lived in the area and eatten there off and on the 3 years, and this just started happening... The owner/manager is a really cool guy, and knows me by name, but the NEW NIGHT CREW there is horrible... Kinda sucks when you want food late after drinkin and thats one of the only places open in the area. I would deffinatly go durring day time and not at night.
author: D. M.

description: Couldn't decide where to go one day with my friends and we found this little spot on the corner. There is a pretty good variety of pizza,subs, and burgers. There's also salads and pie. The subs are awesome and the service is quick.
author: Johnny L.

description: just finished my 1,008th slice of hawaiian from piccolo. like everyone has already said, the crust is perfect, the employees are super-great, and its way too cheap to be that good. five stars, yo.
author: bilbil t.

description: omigod, worst friggin food EVER. do NOT order from here. and the service sucks beyond words. these guys should be shut down just for lack of quality. the bread was hard, the chicken was days old and the fries dry, ugh.  :b
author: bean S.

description: This is the best pizza that I have had in San Francisco... I would call it East Coast meets West Coast.
author: liora k.

description: Pizza is delicious, as are the appetizers. Very fresh ingredients used and owners are very friendly.  Conveniently close to AMC 1000 theater, on corner of O'Farrell and Larkin.
author: Me S.

description: i call they are always on time,the pizza always fresh and hot,i say if you have not tried it you need to,for sure,call em now they are the best
author: greg c.
